However today, my manicurist Michelle stopped my manicure and proceeded to text for 5 minutes (yes, I timed her) right in front of me. She was not waiting for my nails to dry nor was she near done with my manicure. Then, as she was applying the top coat, her hand smudged one of my nails. Obviously this was an honest mistake, and so I just smiled at her. She tried to fix the nail by globbing polish on it, as opposed to redoing it or even just painting smoothly over it. She rushed through the rest of the manicure and was constantly glancing at her phone. Once I was sent to the drying station, I noticed that nail had become clearly crinkled and gross-looking. I didn't see Michelle (my manicurist of the day) anywhere in the area, so I went up to the front desk and politely asked if it wouldn't be too much trouble to fix the nail. They called Michelle from the back room, and she brought me over to the nearest nail station. She proceeded to make pouty noises and complain under her breath about fixing the nail. Once all was said and done and my nails were dry, I went up to the front desk to let them know about the texting issue. "Hi," I smiled, "I just thought I should let you know that my manicurist was texting during my appointment," I told the woman. She murmured out an awkward, "okay...... sorry" under her breath. This was what really upset me. In my opinion, a sincere apology was the least she could have done. I don't know if I will be going back to Anthony Vince, but if I do, I will certainly be requesting one of the male staff.

I love me some wings. This is the best wing stop in town. The manager is really cool. His name is Steve and he always talks with us and he apparently writing a book about names and it totally names sense!! 

Anyways, I like their boneless wings. Best sauce is lemon pepper or hot. I've never tried the atomic but my friend said her mouth and butt was on fire!! 

Their fries are really great when seasoned well. I've ordered too before and they weren't as good. Not sure if they sat too long or just didn't make them as good that day. Today when I came the food was on point, but the free style side machine was missing flavors and drinks.. Sad Nikki.

I have spent several years in and out b of this hospital. Never have I had a complaint other then being so sick and having to wait from time to time for the nursing staff to handle all the emergencies. Good job guys!! Thanks for the care!! Keep up the good work!

Lumpia, pork belly, everything Filipino and did you know they will do private parties as well.  They will pull up in your driveway and give your party THE BEST food, experience and fun.  Follow them on Facebook, go where the food trucks or go, or just have them over.  They are amazing, loving people, too.  Still not sure I'm ready to try the Pig Face...maybe next time.

First time here there were 4 of us and we all got different things. Everything was delicious. The meat on the sandwiches was perfect. The fries were some of the best I had and the service was great. I highly recommend this deli!!!!!!!

Breakfast burritos. Bacon (or sausage) egg and cheese, steak&egg, and bean&cheese are our favorite go to's. Call ahead if you're in a rush, but by the time we get our drinks and fill up our car our burritos are typically ready.

This is our favorite place to check for after market parts. The owner and the cashier knows us pretty well.  They have quality parts in stock.  If not, we show up in person and have them order it.  Much respect to this small shop.

Awful! I would not recommend this place to people who like sushi, or service at a restaurant. I went here with my husband and we ordered one of the sushi combos to share, plus other apps. The spicy tuna rolls that were in the combo were INEDIBLE! they tasted really bad, and like they were expired! which is a complete no go for sushi. I literally spit it out. The service is also sub par. They loom, and like rush you into ordering. Like stand next to you, as you read the menu, and stare at you...and then bring the orders out and like balance the orders on top of each other to minimize the amount of trips they have to take. I'm sorry, but I'd rather not have one of my scallops touching the bottom of my dinner plate. Again, if you love, like, semi-enjoy sushi--don't waste your time here.

Had a hankering today for a good old juicy, sloppy, messy, cheese burger today . . . and I found heaven . . . or at least as close as I can get here on earth.  This place was a 10 . . . that right TEN napkin burger joint . . . the bestest, most unhealthiest burger . . . but sometime that is what you need and crave.

Anyways, I digress . . . I ordered a hamburger on sour dough with swiss cheese . . . only 3 toppings - mushrooms, sauteed onions, and green chilis . . . and only 1 sauce - Sunshine sauce.  For my side . . . I ordered the handmade onion rings.  The bread was grilled and nice and crunchy . . . while the inside oozed gooey greatness . . . while the onion rings weer crispy with a nice sweet taste.

Loved the interior, though it is kinda small . . . but it did take me back to the small beach side joints in San Diego.  A definate return is in the future.

So I had the burger burger burger, great bbq flavor and Smokey taste to it. Also had the crab dip, it was good, decent whiskey drink, service was a bit slow and it wasn't even busy. I would say i would comeback. Maybe better service?

Prana Coffee has a great atmosphere, and the folks behind the counter are really, really nice.

They have a sign in the window claiming that they make the best iced capp. Usually I shrug off these sorts of claims made by cafes and restaurants (they all do it) but in the case of Prana, it's true. If it's not the best, well... it doesn't get much better.

After reading a newspaper review of the cafe, I discovered that the shop continues a coffee roasting tradition going back 120 years, beginning with the great grandfather of the shop's co-founder in Indonesia.

Quite the legacy for a comfy little shop in the beaches!

Went out of my way to come to the mall, thinking it would be less crowded then other Apple stores in the area. It was and I know why, HORRIBLE customer service. I went to buy an iPad pro, could get any of the staff to look in my general direction. After waiting 20 minutes I  was vocal, and was told at this point to sign in as you do for the Genius Bar and somebody would get to me. If this is the case someone should tell you as you enter the store.. I'll still buy Apple products but NEVER at this store.

A las vegas must! Peppermill is lively, fun, HUGE portions delicious breakfast great drinks fun look, fair pricing will definitely stop by next time I'm in town. I personally prefer the breakfast menu. Staff is great, & easy parking!

Grocery shopping is one of those necessary evils.  Fry's at least tries to make the chore bearable.  The staff is pleasant and helpful without being superficial like other chains.  The store is laid out well and if you have a menu, list and keep to the outside ring of the store you can shop healthy and inexpensively. Love the Senior Discount on the 1st Wednesday too!

This is one of my favorite places in the area. One of the best late night spots as well which is very important for this overnight person! Delivery is as perfect as eat in. Amazing pizza, amazing creations, fantastic gluten free and customizations. Anything you want they will do. Love these guys.

As a long time vegetarian who just started eating fish again, this was the first place I went to. They came up as a sustainable place and were very knowledgeable about what they were serving. I couldn't have asked for a better experience.

Over hyped I think. To me the tacos actually lacked flavor. Had a combo of 3 different types and thought they were all somewhat bland and lacked real creativity. Basically its taco truck food (not a bad thing) at probably triple the price (a bad thing). Now the salsa bar is awesome and this is where this place shines. Lots of unique flavors and it is clean and well presented. The chef/cook came out to check on orders so i think they care but the price does not justify the food....

I used them once before, last march (2015).  Fixed my microwave, pretty easy and quick and it was after a horrific experience w/ his former employer, vegas appliance (worst ever). The problem is the fix only lasted 9 months.  Same issue happened, but due to my own finances, I had to wait until now.  I wanted to use him again, since he knew what the problem was.  I contacted him last tuesday, set the appt for thursday.  I rearranged my schedule to be available, and he was a no show. I reached out to him and he said, oh i can't come today, but i can come tomorrow, i said, well ok - set a time and that was that.  So, friday, 20 min after he was supposed to be here, i texted and was like, so are you going to make it ? He called me shortly after and explained that he could not make it today. i said that this was poor conduct of business as you set the time up and i have to call you to find out you can't come, you should be reaching out to me first, well he stated that he is telling me now. I explained that this was the example of bad customer service and that i could be going with anyone, but i selected him. He said well then its your choice on what to do, i don't feel good.  To be honest, he sounded a little messed up. Then he explained that he was not well. i said well if you are not well you should not be making appts. So i said when can you come, he said sunday, i explained that i have people coming over and that would not be acceptable, but this week i am free and that i was trying to help him out but that he needed to tell me when he was available so i could set my scheudle up.  So monday was agreed on  but not before i was explaining i was doing my best to work with him on this, to which he replied, if you were working with me on this then you would be available on sunday. I explained that he needed to watch it, because he is the business man i am hiring, and that him treating me this way was unacceptable.  He also explained that he did go to doctor for his "illness" and that he would not take the medicine due to side effects.  i explained that if he wants to do good business he better get well and quit making appt promises that he can't keep and affecting the customers and their life with us having to keep rearranging our schedules.  Today he was supposed to come (april 11th 2016) at 8 am but i texted him at 830 am. finally he calls me and said i could not come at 8, to which i was super mad already and explained that i was not surprised and he could expect me to write a bad review on yelp and not get any referalls or another good word from me.  to which he said well if you were going to be avaiable tomorrow, i was going to fix it for free. i explained that at this point i don't trust him to work on my microwave and he can keep his lame attempt and forget it at this point.  It will be worth going to sears and dealing with a reputable company that is reliable and such.  so disappointing...

I have been to this bakery several times and have never been disappointed. These pastries are very well prepared with quality ingredients, always fresh, creative and delicious. Counter staff is always pleasant and helpful.
it was cool neat diff stuff to choose from. would go backé staff staff are a laid back. easy to find.

We have been here several times and like to take out of town visitors there for a meal. We really enjoy the comfortable atmosphere, friendly staff and great food. My favorite is the Roulade and red cabbage. My husband always enjoys the Schnitzel. My two sons, who can be quite picky, always find something to enjoy and have tried many items on the menu. They are a bit pricey, but it is a unique meal and freshly prepared so we don't mind.
We have noticed that there is not as big of a crowd as when they first opened, which is usually expected. We hope they can keep regulars coming, so that they stay going. With so many options in Henderson, it seems like the good ones disappear. Love you Bavarian Castle!!

Dr. Patty is the best. We brought our newly adopted puppy in for her exam, and Dr. Patty was patient and answered all of our questions and then some. She's thorough, is very nice and her staff is just as wonderful. 
We hope to have a long relationship with Dr. Patty and our puppy.

Went in a few weeks ago after having this be my "go to" salon for years. Have seen many quality techs come and go. Had an appointment for mani/Pedi for me and my daughter. Seemed to be some confusion about the fact that we EACH wanted mani/Pedi but who would know since the manager Jennifer wasn't there to give us the gracious service we are accustomed to. Rachael has done our nails several times since she has been at LK and fretted is like she had never seen us before. Seriously?  I am so tired of going into nail places where the good techs leave and they make you feel like it is an inconvenience that you have come in.  Salon itself is not as nice as when it first opened; light fixtures are dirty, floor mop bucket was stored in restroom and they used to offer bottled water when you come in. Going to find a nail salon where they do quality work, atmosphere is welcoming and caring that I come in and the salon is clean. Goodbye, LK Salon.

Walked in at 1230pm on a Saturday and was seated immediately by a friendly hostess. The restaurant was packed but luckily there was an open table, despite it being situated in very close proximity to the neighbouring table. I started with a 16oz "all greens" juice which was delicious and tart and very well priced at $8 for its size. My friend and I each ordered the baby size "green goddess bowl" with basmati rice (mine with grilled tofu steaks, hers with crispy tofu cubes), and an order of onion rings with the chipotle mayo dipping sauce. The bowls were flavourful, the pickled ginger gave it a nice extra kick. The onion rings were OUT OF THIS WORLD, by far the best onion rings I have ever had. If you walk out of this establishment without trying them, you are making a huge mistake!!

First of all...I love the Roadrunner Farmer's Market on Saturdays....It  has introduced to so many fun, yummy local foods, Molly's Tamales being one of those.
Tamales are one of my favorite bits of Mexican fare, the almighty enchilada being number one, and I'm always on the hunt for the perfect tamale.  I think I may have found it!  I have only enjoyed their goodies via the market and have yet to visit their actual establishment.
So far I have had the southwest chicken, chicken & spinach and my new all time favorite.....wait for it!   The wild Alaskan salmon tamale!  Yes, I know you purists are probably shouting blasphemy, but seriously, it is insanely good!  I had one for breakfast this morning:  holy crap!!!!!   
Here are your marching orders:
1.  Find Molly's Tamales...
2.  Buy some tamales...
3.  Eat them and scream in mouth-gasmy bewilderment!

PS - A successful reheating is necessary, so wrap it in a wet paper towel and nuke for 1 minute for the goodness...

I got a BBQ bowl. You choice of filing. Rice beans or Mac and cheese. Your choice of meat and your choice of toppings. I did cilantro rice, brisket, Cole slaw, and corn. The brisket had good flavor but on the drier side. Overall okay if your in north Phoenix and want some BBQ. A little pricey.  For a 24 oz drink and the BBQ now the total was 17 bucks.

The guys behind the counter were slow. The contents of the bowl were not consistent with two other people who were in my party.

Really good food and fun atmosphere with the surfboard tables.  Everyone was super friendly.  After ordering at the counter, we sat down and enjoyed the tv videos of surfers.  Our food came out very quickly.  The fish tacos were fantastic, albeit a bit messy.   I would definitely order those again!  B/F had the fish and chips and he really liked those as well as the coconut slaw.  They also have nice beer.  I think it is a bit pricey for the casual atmosphere (I can see folks being more willing to pay those prices on vacation in Maui).  That being said, if it was a fancy atmosphere, folks would pay those prices all day long and think it was a steal as the quality is so good.

Had a cheeseburger. Sign says 100% fresh, I have a hard time believing that. Patties look pre formed. Onion rings looked pre battered. As another reviewer wrote burger was cold. Cheese was not melted. Bun was dry. Looked good, so points for presentation. The onion rings I got were mostly the small middle pieces and ended up very oily and soggy. The normal size pieces were good. Probably will not go back based on the below average burger.

First off this resort is perfect for families in Las Vegas. There's no casinos and no smoking. The pool and lazy river is great for the kids. The rooms are nice and clean. We had a Bali room that had a full kitchen and washer dryer. The place is actually a timeshare. 

The staff deserves a perfect 5 stars. They are very courteous. 

Now the bad. We made reservations for 5 nights but had an emergency and wanted to leave after the 3rd night and was hoping for a refund for the 2 unused nights.   I was on the phone with them for over 30 minutes bouncing from one person to another.  They just kept repeating the policy of no refunds without 48 hours advanced notice.   I spoke with 4 people and each time I asked of a manager. But they all were like robots repeating the policy to me. 

We come here each year with 18 other families but got no sympathy.  They can't even give me credit for our next visit.  Their inflexibility and unwillingness to work with me was very disappointing and it is a shame for such a family oriented place.

For the management they get zero star for doing nothing for me.

Ordered the diablo potatoes, scrambled eggs, bacon, and chocolate chip pancakes. The portions are nice sized and everything was fantastic. There was no wait and the server was efficient and pleasant. My boyfriend's food was excellent as well. Great breakfast spot!

OMG 
Best amazing experience ever 
I believe the person that helped us her name was
Tera what a wonderful employee you have she went over and above to assist my husband & myself since we are a older generation we aren't as fast as the young crowd she explained everything to us showed us how to use are new phones totally a 5 star rating .
There was another man there the time we had ordered the phones however he was kinda weird and we kinda felt uncomfortable with that employee and he wasn't very helpful and he seemed not trustworthy 
However we still continued since we feel Sprint would not have dishonest employees working for them.
We both enjoy are new phones I have the 7 plus & my husband has iPhone 7, he said he wished he would have waited for the iPhone 7plus though 
Thank you for checking on our experience your awesome 
O gosh I thought I posted this so the first post above I found that I must have not sent it in until today sorry .
We also recently had the pleasure of having Tara helping us once again recently up grade our phones My husband Woody called sprint and after getting shuffled around to two different people for about a hour got frustrated and hung up then called your sprint store on McDowell & 99th ave and within 10 minutes Tara assisted us with solving the problem Tara is a Gem what a super caring employee you have that goes over and above to truly help her customers  I wanted Sprint to know 
Thank You Woody & Cindy Olson

Awesome Donuts! 

The only thing is, I was expecting the light fluffy glazed that Krispy Kreme has. This is not the same. HOWEVER these donuts are homemade delicious and why not support small businesses?!?! 

So why the 4/5 star instead of 5/5? Well the majority of our group LOVED the donuts and swears by them. HOWEVER, one or two just thought they were alright and preferred a light airy donut a la Krispy Kreme (lameeee). So thats why I am trying to represent all opinions here in my reviews.

We were headed there when they were closing the dining room apparently (the drive thru is 24 hours though), but the nice lady allowed us to come inside, we had a rather large group with us. 

THE BUTTERMILK donut is amazing!! TOTALLY worth the late night trip!!!

These donuts taste fresh, delicious, and the customer service was so great when we were there that night. This place is the best donut place I have been to in AZ. No more KKreme or DDonuts (that place is not that good anyway). Just go to Bosa and you will never go to a chain donut shop again.

In town for a long weekend.  Came from the cold NE, so naturally needed to clean up/cool off.  Low key, comfortable atmosphere. A quick, no nonsense yet quite adept cut, perfectly following my instructions. Couldn't have asked for more at such a reasonable price.
Great place to watch football and can't beat the prime rib species for Thursday night for 8.99. Our waitress Bella was super nice and friendly also.
Love Caine's food but stopped to get a sweetened ice tea here and had to dump it. It was straight sugar water-like drinking Karo syrup. Obviously no one tastes what they serve to customers.

Green chili anything is awesome! I always go for chicken sandwich w/ green chili mayo. Been going there for years and can't ever order anything else. No need to when you go there for what you want. They now have 2 locations one in N Mesa is good but definitely not the original, watch out for snow birds!

Delicious food and wonderful service. Enjoyed the Greek crepe as well as the Berry one. Awesome how their menu is not limited to sweet crepes. The mimosa sampler was delicious. Enjoyed being able to sample their top 3 (peach, blood orange, and guava - LOVED the peach one!!). Service was wonderful and they offer outdoor seating which is awesome as long as the weather is right. Will definitely be returning to Crepe Expectations!!!

The home builder that I purchased my new home from was going to charge me a crazy amount for my flooring. I called over to Marvin and he found the same flooring for a quarter of the price.
The purchase was easy and Marvin even suggested a great installer as well. If you have to buy flooring you have to deal with Marvin and the team over at Prosource!

Thanks again for everything Marvin!

You are the best!!!!!!!!!!

Spring Mountain Ranch State Park is a beautiful 520 acre park in the Red Rock Conservation area about 20 miles west of Las Vegas down the road from the town of Blue Diamond on Hwy 159. This is another great example that there are so many places near L.V. to explore the natural beauty this state has to offer and escape the hustle and bustle of Las Vegas.

The park is 1 mile north of Bonnie Springs, and being a state park requires an entry fee. $9 for non residents and $7 for Nevada residents. The park is full of natural beauty. Located at 3800 feet in elevation it is usually cooler than in town. The road winds up to the parking area, and this leads to a large grassy meadow surrounded by large mature trees, bbq grills and picnic tables along with restrooms on property. Very nice. The property is backed up by the Spring Mt. Ranch and Red Rock which creates stunning vistas behind the park.

There is the main house/ranch that is still on site. It has a pretty interesting history owned by several people through the years including Howard Hughes at one time. You can tour the house and it is furnished and has many pictures, artifacts etc from its history of owners. Actually very interesting. There is a small gift shop on property with such things as cactus agave jelly and rattlesnake shaped coffee cups. One of which is sitting in my cabinet, from when my wife bought one years ago during our first visit. There are also a few hiking trails in the park that lead back toward the mountains, and one trail that leads to a small lake. Very pretty. 

Overall a nice place to spend an afternoon for a hike or picnic or bbq. And get away from the city and enjoy Nevada's natural beauty. One more tip there is also a Summer Theater that runs usually June-Sept. And offers different plays, some of them Broadway hits. They are held in the evenings and you bring a blanket and food and sit out on the grass lawn and watch the show. Nice way to watch a play. Check this State Park out!!

I have now been here several times. There are many highlights to this new location. There is no store within a mile  that has its variety. It is Really is for tourists & those living close by that may need a last minute item. This location is very much like a small grocery market, minus the produce. At NIGHT,  parking is in the back BuT ,doors only open in front. 
Highlights Extensive Soup/Dinner/coffee/tea isles
                    Candy every kind imaginable , movie size
                     Yummy frozen comfort food area
                      ICECREAM, SEVERALLL KINDS :-)
                    Tons of junk food & large area with 
                     Healthier choices of nuts
                      Alcohol area is large . All popular vodkas, 
                      Bottles, etc. 
                      DOM & ACE for that last
                      Minute Celebration. 
                      Some higher end hair care brands
                      
Prices here are higher & do reflect the convenience of location but all in all,  true upgrade to area.
Pharmacy on site. 
All kinds of travel items, phone batteries, music headphones,etc..in case you lost or forgot to pack something.

Very gorgeous (Moroccan inspired?) spa.  The facilities were large and very very nice.  We had a bachelorette party here an had a package with a 50 min service of our choice, a $15 food voucher (which was enough for a meal) and champagne.  They greeted us with bath bombs in the shape of cute little cupcakes for the bridal party! 

They reserved us a table for lunch out in the pool deck but in the heat wave it definitely wasn't covered, had anything misters, or any shade.  We opted to use two small tables right in the entrance instead.  For such a nice spa I would think they'd invest in misters and some more umbrellas! The pool was also very small and lacked the fountain of adding new cold water, therefore the pool was way too hot to be refreshing.  And the pool wasn't necessarily the cleanest either - it had a ton of sand at the bottom and the service at the pool area was slow.  

The service and facility for everything else was great! They had nice rooms for the messages and facials.  A nice social lounge area and a quiet area with tempurpedic beds for rest.  There was a cold bath, a hot tub (wish there was a cold tub), a sauna, a steam room, a gym, etc.  The decor and walkways were definitely really nice and unique.  My deep tissue massage was pretty amazing and the other girls loved their services as well.  

I think if they worked on their pool area and some refreshing options for the summer heat, it'll be perfect.  The food options were also pretty healthy.. Not the most amazing food but it works.  And they're right on time for appointments - always a plus to be super punctual!

A really good bar in what seems to be a pretty generic scene in this area of Toronto. 

There are a couple things that I feel really set it apart from your average bar:

- The really extensive selection of Canadian brews, and the very informative menu that goes with it. I was really impressed that it even shows you how bitter each beer is to help you make a selection you'll enjoy.
- The sort of underground cave thing it has going on. It's got stone walls, and it feels like you're drinking in a cellar. Very nice.

The service we got was friendly and attentive. On a Friday night the place was pretty packed - enough to be fun but not overly loud or to have any wait times for tables. They have a pool table, which I always love in a bar. Prices were not bad either. I would definitely want to return if I found myself in this hood again.
The mole chicken is very good!!! The horchata is fresh made on site and ridiculously great tasting.

I was looking for a great steak place that wouldn't break the bank for my friends and I. The reviews were pretty good so we decided to give it a shot! I was very happy that we chose Joe's! The sevice was excellent! My husband and I split the ribeye and we had the crab legs (only happens 4 weeks out of the year so why not?!). The ribeye was good, but it wasn't the best. The crab legs were by far the best I've ever had in my life. AMAZING! Sides were good too. We had the mac & cheese (was just the right amount of creamy- I find restaurants make it too dry for my tastes, but I love it!), mashed potatoes (YUM), and the brussels (eh). All in all, I was VERY pleased with my experience. Wouldn't say it was the best, but would say it was pretty darned good. Overall, I'd give it a 8.5/9.

Why is this place still open? Staff are unfriendly at best, and rude generally. Asking for simple things like a bread plate for the bread knots is apparently an inconvenience. 

The tv is blaring some obnoxious news station and she blatantly ignored multiple requests to change the station. My daughter first asked and she rudely just said no. 

The pizza slice my daughter got was so greasy, that it dripped off in this reddish-orange greasy liquid. She refused to eat it. 

I ordered eggplant pasta, which was okay, but nothing special, especially for $11 a plate.

It's a dive. If you like that sort of place, then you might like it here. But, just be aware that they don't charge "dive" prices.
I bring my dog here and the staff are very helpful and kind. They are always able to get us in for emergency appointments and I've always had a great experience no matter what we're coming in for.

I've been coming to the joint for almost 6 months now, and I could not be happier with the service. I almost never have to wait to be seen and my doctor always fixes me right up! My favorite part is that I don't need an appointment and I can be seen after I get off work and on weekends. I recommend this place to anyone with any kind of pain because I love it so much! Thank you Joint Chiropractic!!

I want to preface this by saying that I've been getting mani/pedis for over 18 years, all over the world. This place is overpriced, especially for the quality you get. I've had $12 pedicures that would dance circles around these. The woman that took care of my mother was very nice and friendly and she had a good experience, which is why it gets two stars instead of one. The man on the phone said he had openings for two pedicures at 1:45PM.  We got seated in massage chairs in about 5ish minutes, but they are squished together that some of the chairs can't use their built in tables to set a purse or anything on. The only place I had to set my purse and shoes were right in front of the lady in the chair next to mine. My mother was already 15 minutes (or 20) into her pedicure when I finally got someone. He was not friendly but was at least polite. I wanted a two tone ombre style that I had seen posted on this site but he could not do it so he was going to do all little toes one color and then another woman would do the ombre on the big toe. My mother talked me into the luxury pedicure ($30, $20 for basic) and they missed a crucial aspect of even the most basic pedicure. Clean out the fuzz and left ivers that get worked in from socks or wedge in dirt in those corners from wearing flip flops all the time. The guy said he needed to put white on the toe for the ombre so of course I said ok. When he got done, I only waited maybe 5 minutes for the other lady to come do the ombre style. My eyes are not the best and, from where I was sitting, it looked good. Upon closer inspection, it was a very shoddy attempt and a lot fo the white was still showing on the side, along with polish left on the skin. When we went to grab our stuff, I noticed, as walking to the register, my side was cold and damp now. I checked and my large purse was completely soaked through and had leaked on to my shirt and pants. There were no liquids in my purse or that I brought in that could have done. All the other other customers in the store saw this and each made a comment about it. Thankfully, none of the liquid had gotten to my electronics yet. Not a single employee said anything or acknowledged that anything had happened. We will definitely never be coming here again and I will not recommend this place.

tl;dr Overpriced and poor quality. Go somewhere else.
After hearing from the staff, I gave Modern Grove another try, and was very pleased with the meal/service.

I used to really enjoy getting takeout from this location. Lately the store has become a little rundown and the service (especially when ordering over the phone) is really lacking, to the point of being rude.

Ambiance intimiste, nous avons été servis rapidement et comme des rois. Les plats sont très goûteux et copieux. On a testé le crabe, le homard et un poulet thaï. Le filet mignon au lard et le newyork sirloin étaient parfaits. bref un très bon moment de dégustations en famille.
Le service est personnalisé, on prend bien soin de vous durant votre court mais savoureux "séjour". De plus ils bénéficient d'un large choix d'apéritifs ce qui pourrait en ravir certains. Il faut y mettre le prix. On espère pouvoir revenir ici très vite !
Been coming here for a couple of years now and have always had good service. And their pizzas are the best I've tasted compared to pizza pizza and pizza hut well except for mine that is. lol

Dr. Rick Owen owns this. He has been a D.C. for many years in Las Vegas. He is caring and knowledgeable. He takes time to help you understand what your problems may be. I'm a LMT and I highly recommend him for his professionalism and high quality of care.

Audrey did an awesome job with my brows..she's excellent and I recommend her to anyone wanting the perfect brows..don't go anywhere else.                        I can actually say,my eyebrows are on fleek!!!!!

This place is quant and cozy. The service was fantastic, husband and wife team. Super friendly and food was good.  Biscuits and gravy where delish, and love they made me iced coffee. The price was really great. They have daily specials. I appreciate a mom and pop place, they work hard to build a customer base. This place is well on its way, only opened in Nov. 2015. So give them a try.

After meeting with Nathan and his wife we knew this was our DJ. Nathan is extremely talented and also offered to Emcee our wedding to ensure the flow of events never waivered. He brings plenty of extras to your event that include uplights, video, and stage lighting. Our guests didn't want the dance party to end! Nathan and his wife were a pleasure to work with and made themselves fully available to answer questions we had at anytime. They made our day perfect!

Pour une réunion de job, l'entreprise décida de nous réserver une salle au bar de cette auberge. Nous y étions une quarantaine, tout se déroula à merveille, tant pour la sono que le côté technique (utilisation des tv, etc). Nous y avons passé la soirée, l'alcool étant abordable et le lieu hyper accueillant ! Comme c'est une auberge jeunesse, nous avions vraiment l'impression d'être à l'extérieur de Montréal et nous-même en voyage. Je recommande fortement pour une bonne soirée pour petit budget !

The environment was great and the drinks were alright, but was a little disappointed that they didn't add whip cream to my blended drink, but were adding it to every other drink, it's sort of an expected thing. The employee making our drinks was talking to friends the whole time while making the drinks, it was hard to maneuver around them and hear our names to get our drinks.. But otherwise the place is very cozy.

A better than average buffet. Food is served in small single serving plates that are often visually interesting. The restaurant itself actually looks like a higher end contemporary restaurant. Food was pretty good but still not "order off the menu" quality. I'd recommend it if you're nearby.
My first time experience was good our server was nice the chief was funny and the food was well cooked!

Worst Panera ever!!! They are always out of something or a machine is broken. In the past three weeks I have been there 4 times. Twice their toaster was broken in the morning. The third time they were out of American cheese. What restaurant runs out of cheese at 10:30 in the morning. Management really needs to either be replaced or trained properly. I'd rather drive a bit further and get better quality and service.

In my experience of eating Indian food in many North American cities Gandhi stands out. Excellent spicing. Excellent selection. Excellent service. Had the tandoori chicken, a cauliflower dish and spinach with potatoes. Mmmm. Had to take some home. It was equally good the next day. A great experience!

Fantastic service on a Saturday morning brunch! I had the biscuits and beer chorizo gravy. It had a nice kick and tasted delicious. My friend got a panini with a side of potatoes which were  also pretty amazing. Toss in some fresh squeezed orange juice and I'm a happy customer. Ambiance is nice. Outdoor patio is well shaded, but beware sitting by the flowers, there are lots of flies.

Ryan has to be the most unprofessional person I've ever met. He came to my house to repair my screen but didn't have all the equipment to complete the job. He left saying he would be back the next morning. I have him a $30 tip and expected to see him to finish fixing my phone. Long story short he kept in contact via my texts, but always had excuses about making it back over. After 5 days of trying he has completely avoided me. I feel robbed and taken advantage of. I will make sure to warn everyone about this incompetent "tech". There are so many cheaper techs that take their job seriously- don't waste your time and take a chance with this 21 yr old kid.

Baseball brings a community together. I always liked baseball and one of fun ways to spend on the road during the summer is to visit ball park as many as possible.  I usually buy home team t-shirts and hat and cheer for a home team to enjoy a game and atmosphere.

On this particular day I visited the Chase Field, they didn't fail to deliver great game, fun atmosphere and brought the community together. 

They were giving out D-backs T-shirts to the first 5,000 moms, so we arrived around 10:50am to wait in line.  When we showed up, there were about 150 already waiting.  While we were waiting, one of the players came out to greet us. I thought it was such nice gesture, although I didn't know who he was I appreciated the fact he came out to talk to some of us waiting for a long time for gates to open.

Gates opened at 11:30am for 1:10pm game.  They were very organized to give out the T-shirts, they made it easy for us.  They had size L and XL at the gates, and they told us to go near the section 145 to exchange to other size M or XXL. They had plenty of staff on the ground to make the process very smooth.  Thank you D-Backs for the nice T-shirts. I proudly wore them during the game.

I like the way they organized and bring the 20,000 plus crowds together to cheer for the home team.  It takes a lot of baseball loving staff to run a game in the way so organized.

On Sunday, kids get to run the base, but on Mother's Day, Moms get to run the base too!  Once a year event, and I always enjoy running the base with the kids.  Great way to spend Mother's Day!
Employees are always rude, tables are dirty, chicken is dry, wait is too long. Save yourself the time and drive down the street to PDQ. More sauce options and menu variety. Staff is very friendly.

First time visiting Spartan Arms, I'm a new dad with my 6mo old in tow. It's hot and I need to get from the truck to inside the store as fast as we can so we don't burn up. I get him out of the seat, put him in the stroller and head for the door. I get to the front door and one of the employees saw me struggling and actually came and opened the door for me...THAT my friends is service! Beautiful store, tons of products and good prices but the best thing is the service and thoughtfulness of the employees...that makes the difference between going back or not...I'll be back.

Bistro on Main is, by far the best restaurant in the Kent area.  We visit every year from Orange County, CA and we are sure to get at least one meal in at Bistro.  If you're looking for real gourmet/fine dining in the area, this is the place to go!  Everything we have had is very tasty and original....the menu is a bit seasonal so you may not find everything below at all times of year but that's great because they only like to use fresh ingredients...some of our favorites are...

1.  Grilled avocado salad with watermelon, mango, and red onion
2.  Wild caught scallops with arugula and orzo
3.  Short rib - fall apart, very tender - served with mixed veggies
4.  Their regular house salad  - a mix of fresh greens, candied walnuts, feta cheese, onion etc...you can add your protein of choice if you choose
5.  Flank steak over beans with grilled green onions and bell pepper
6.  Pork chop with sweet potato mash, applewood smoked bacon and spinach

Good wines....reasonable prices considering the high quality of food.  We have always had great service as well.

I've always been happy with the service I get at Professor. Always. Sometimes, though, the way that management handles a problem says a lot about the business. I was in Friday, and had a gel mani started by someone who was new. I wasn't very happy with how things were going. Cindy, the manager, stepped in personally and took over. She gave me a great mani at much less than the cost. She went out of her way to make sure that I was taken care of. I really appreciated this. People do make mistakes in any business, but it was how she handled it that made a difference. I will definitely keep using Professor Nails!
It's pretty average. I like that I can get a grass fed burger here for a good price. It's a little too dark in the evening, and always feels a little dirty.

This was my first experience with spray tanning. Danielle's confidence and warmth instantly put me at ease.  Her passion shines through... no doubt she's done this for years and loves what she does. During the process, she was clear on how she needed me positioned and I really appreciated her treating me like a work of art, not missing a spot.   I won't go anywhere else.   Thanks Danielle!

Always a clean restaurant. Fast service. That's what subway is suppose to be. Quick! It amazes me how much responsibility is thrown on the employees, and especially when having to work all by themselves a lot of times.
When in Vegas, FAVE, FAVE , FAVE!!! You can't beat the patio location and the steak frites with Merlot butter!

We were lured in by the appearance/atmosphere from outside. We expected a nice dining experience.
We waited 20 minutes for a table which is usually indicative of a great establishment so we didn't mind.
However.
It was not all that great. Disappointing, actually.

The food was sub par to say the least. Caesar salad was bland and had no bacon bits. Which is odd since we know they have bacon. It comes on almost every burger.

What were supposed to be medium-rare filet mignon shish kebob were served to me well-done instead and they were very chewy.

The waitress forgot to bring my date's second beer, so when she realized this, she said if he still wants it, she wouldn't charge him for it, so he said okay, then she went ahead and put it on the bill anyway.
Also, when she saw how much food we had left on our plates, she laughingly pointed out that the portions are "crazy big" here. Well, that would have been nice to know before we ordered, not after we finished eating.

They have an inviting ambience from outside, but it ends there. Just not any better than the next pub.
Very clean dining room. Did not see the bathroom. Lukewarm onion rings, but it may just be when I got them.

I have found my 'Vetos' of Madison!!!!! (If you don't know what I'm talking about reference down to my review of Vetos (;)

So happy when my roommates brought me here, and when I learned that they deliver! And they serve beer :)

Definitely a place to hit up after the bar from some good Drunk People Food. My roommates ended up getting the steak quesidilla, tater tots, and the chips and cheese (Which is just tortilla chips and a cup of cheese) and their friend got the Fish Tacos, I on the other hand got possibly the best tasting thing ever at 2am The Hungry Hippie Burrito. So good, yet so messy! It had Rice, tater tots, guac, and Mexican salw I believe it was. I got a side of Sour Cream, and their Red Salsa with it. It paired perfectly while watching Family Guy on the TV (You never can go wrong with Family Guy while eating a burrito, drunk.) 

I only finish about a 4th of it due to it being so big, but bagged up the left overs, and was on our way.

The service wasn't very good. Multiple waiters kept coming to the table to get drink orders. None were particularly friendly . Then when we wanted to order couldn't get the server.  The food was just okay; nothing outstanding.

Charming boutique stationery store on a quaint street on the East Side. It's very nicely laid out, not cluttered, and has a great custom section in the back of the store. Laurel and the girls offered great customer service while helping me pick out some cute Luscious Verde moving announcements (coincidentally a Cleveland company -- nice).

There's also a bakery next door which offers mind-blowing chocolate croissants, but I guess that's another review entirely.

This is our favorite Chinese restaurant!  The food is always delicious, flavorful and the service is terrific.  The portions are also great for the money!  They also have lunch and dinner specials.  Food is made to order, nice and hot.  You will not be disappointed.
The savory crepes have no taste, completely bland and overpriced... Look elsewhere in Montreal for crepes...

Great food and experience! We showed up around 5:30 with a party of 8 and were told the wait would be an hour, which was pretty much right on.

Server was quick, friendly and open with his recommendations.

Only a few in our party ordered cocktails (margaritas) and the were very tasty. The iced tea was good, too. Food was excellent; our party tried many different items and everyone was pleased. Start with the guacamole, it's prepared table side; a unique and delicious recipe. As an entree I had the cochinitas pibil and it was very good. The pork was tender and juicy and the sauce gave it just a bit of kick. Dessert was yummy, too; we tried the churros and chocolate cake...churros were the winner, hands down.

They did add an auto-gratuity at the end, which drives me crazy at a nice restaurant for a large, adult party. We always tip, usually better than the auto-gratuity; I resent the implication that we wouldn't or wouldn't tip as well, but maybe I'm just sensitive.

I went to Nellie's for the first time since I live in the neighborhood.  The service was great and staff were friendly but the food was mediocre! I ordered the Eggs Benedict with smoked salmon. First the potatoes need some help in flavor, something about the seasoning was off. The meal was not very palatable. I was expecting a nice serving of fruit but it was a slice of orange, a piece of melon and 3 grapes or so!  I would keep walking and find a more favorable brunch spot!

Our first visit here.  Marisa the server,  I hope that was her name was very nice. and helped us with the menu.  We had the Tom Kha gai chicken coconut soup had amazing flavors.  And we also had the pad woon sen cellophane noodle just perfectly spiced.  . So far my new favorite thai place hoping to try the sushi next time.

Went there with 2 friends on Sunday for early dinner.  The cost was $22 plus tax for all you can eat.  

Pros: 
- pretty cheap for sushi

Cons:
- nothing outstanding
- not fresh (frozen)

Food:
- The food is good, nothing amazing.  We had all you can eat, so I will put some things I noticed
- Sushi - They do not have Tuna, Most of the sushi is based salmon and shrimp.  I ordered some sashimi, and some it came frozen
- Teriyaki - The beef and chicken are tasty, but it is noticeable that high quality meet is not used.
- Desert - They got good ice cream, they do not have deep friend bananas as other places do

Service:
- They seem to be understaffed. There are only a few waitresses, which makes time to order food and get it a bit above average.  When I ordered ice cream, she forgot to bring a spoon, which she noticed and said she was going to bring it right away.  5 minutes later I had to remind her again

Locale: decent but a bit crowded.  I would recommend asking to go to the back room with booths
Really good happy hour!! Ambience checked! Food checked!!! Service... amazing and fast! Over all will definitely come back.
I locked myself out of my car and this guy was there in 15 minutes. His rate was reasonable and he was done in less than five minutes. I'm very glad I called him.
dream come true. original fashion,amazing staff.
Always a great variety of local meats and produce in all dishes. Great appetizers and dessert options. Can't wait to try their brunch!

This is what fast food restaurants should strive to be. When you are on the go and want to eat healthy, look no further.....Cafe Zupas is your stop. Fresh, crisp and flavorful salads. A very robust variety of gourmet salads paired with a perfectly made sandwich. Feel free to mix and match. I have been here multiple times and every experience has been exceptional. I am completely enamored with the honey infused drinks. They are light and delicious, a perfect balance of sweetness and subtle flavor. The clam chowder is so good, creamy and velvety.
Food is delicious. Fantastic atmosphere and decor. Great selection of wines. Service is perfect. Highly recommended.

Very glad i called this company. I received very prompt quality service. The gentleman was at my house within an hour and fixed my garage door right away. The price for the repair was half of what another company quoted me. Please take into consideration that this was on a Saturday afternoon!!  So they did not take advantage of us. No extra charges. Just excellent service. Highly recommend this company. A++++++++

I've been going to this place to get my hair done for 4 years now.
I am a Korean male and I am very VERY picky about how my hair gets cut, dyed, or permed.
Not once have they failed me.
I get my hair cut by the guy that works there (there is only one guy)
and every time I go, I just take a photo and give clear instructions on how I want my hair to be cut.
Their willingness to listen and their careful attention to detail is what keeps me going back.
If you're like me and you're picky about how your hair is cut or if you're just looking for something fresh and new to experiment with, give this place a shot. 
You will NOT regret it.

Loved Copper Blues! New to Arizona and was looking for a Bar/Grill type of place with good food, drinks and live Music. Black Bottom Lighters were playing that night so that alone was a plus. The atmosphere was perfect, busy but not too loud. Was still able to have good conversation with my fiancé.

We were really there for the music and beer but were pleasantly surprised with the food. We had the Steak Bites, Pretzels & beer sauce. Sooo ridiculously good for our finger food cravings that night!  Our waitress was nice and really knew her beer list. I recommend this spot to friends all the time!

This was the most horrible for I've had in YEARS! I'm pretty forgiving but I can't forgive the junk they cooked here. Please don't go, you will be horribly dissatisfied...I went at 12:30pm on a Friday.

A really good Japanese curry restaurant. After being seated and ordering, we had to ask to get our waters. Also, the ratio of rice to curry was a little bit off for me (more rice than curry) but besides that, the currys are pretty good. I probably will be coming back, just not anytime soon
Great food, the meat on tacos and fries was amazing very moist and flavorful. We will absolutely be going back.
Great experience -- we will be going back!  Great food and service!  The scallops with mushroom risotto was excellent! My husband had the lamb shank and that was also excellent!

Three meat combo will fill up most anyone. The ribs, and pulled pork were 4 stars in my opinion. The brisket was 3 stars at best today. It was dry with no flavor. Potato salad was very good as the baked beans were also. I eat a lot of barbecue all over the country so I might be more critical but I still give them 4 stars and I would go back again.

The best Creme brûlée I have ever had! My Husband loved the Bavarian sausage, the bacon slab and the prime Rib. This was our second time visiting this restaurant and we will definitely return on our next Vegas trip.
Staff are always friendly and fast.  The drinks are always delicious and it's cheaper than most bubble tea shops around.

what can you say, 5 STARS is 5 STARS.  called them in the late morning said they could be here probably by 3:30 to 4pm.  Called around 2:30pm and said they were running behind (expected for an end of day appointment) and would be here between 5:30 and 6pm.  Got here at 5:50pm.  Both gentlemen were friendly and yet professional.  Denton "D" was the main plumber and he had a helper.  I had a simple front sink clog but they had to run 75 feet of line to clean it which isn't a bad idea for a drain that's hadn't been cleaned in the 12 years I lived in the house.  Finished within an hour.  Awesome team and I would recommend them to anyone.  At the end, "D" thanked me and said I was the friendliest customer he had all day and it was a great way to end it.

My husband and I chose this moderately-priced hotel for a four-day/three night stay in Montreal. It offered free parking, on-site restaurant, and close proximity to the wedding we were attending.  It was nicer than some of the hotels in the area in which the other wedding guests stayed, and in at least one case the price was less at Hotel Universel Montréal.  We certainly got better service and a cleaner room than some of them! 

We went to the restaurant the first night.  Nothing fancy, but the price reflected this and we were not disappointed.

Our room was comfortable and clean.  Again, nothing fancy, but it was very comfortable and certainly offered everything we needed.

Most important:  service.  My husband and I get wonderful service often enough that we can compare and contrast, and we expect to receive wonderful service across the board.  Great service began when we checked in: the gentleman who checked us in highlighted the map with the areas we'd had on our itinerary, drew routes for us to help avoid some of the construction on the roadways, and even made tourist suggestions that turned out to be pretty good.  

An error occurred during our stay. No one was hurt; it affected no one in the world but me, but it hit me hard and I was very angry.  I asked to speak with the manager.  I was as polite as I could be under the circumstances.  Simon, the manager, was not only professional, but he was warm and he was obviously distraught when he heard what had happened. Quite frankly, I can't believe that he managed to make me feel better even though I was so very upset, and I was glad for the opportunity to tell his manager that he is lucky to have Simon on staff.

Of note: When my husband and I came in from the Botanical Gardens that evening, a gentleman at the desk stopped us. He wanted to personally tell me that the error had been his, and that he was sorry.  Since we didn't know him, he could have let us slip by and we would not have known the difference, and that really stood out as five-star service.

Everyone at the front desk was friendly. When we checked out, they moved the line quickly while treating everyone as if s/he was the only guest there.  Nicely done.

We didn't have enough time to see most of what Montreal had to offer, and the lack of parking downtown due to construction didn't help.  When we go back, we'll be making our reservations at the Hotel Universel Montréal.

Order ground beef burger medium rare made fresh with soup and salad... 

Got seated quickly and food was hot and fresh... I had to run out to see a friend on the street and server went as far as warming up my food for me again...

Will surely go back!
This location has the worst service. 20 minutes waiting for a taco salad and potato wedges. I wish they would get their stuff together.

Take out orders are only accepted in person.

I called to place an order, received a very annoyed employee on the phone,  and was told (reluctantly) that they do take out orders, but you have to place the order in person. 

I don't understand the policy. 
The employee was rude. (Main reason for the low rating)

I probably won't eat there in the future. Luckily,  I ordered from another local restaurant. Excellent service and food.
Went for dinner last night and while the food was very good, the service was rushed and attention to detail was definitely lacking. Didn't live up to my expectation.

It was different, and my husband and I enjoyed it. The chicken pho came with two fairly large cooked chicken breasts instead of shredded chicken. The sauce they used on it was a nice added touch. The portion size of the broth was also generous and enjoyable. Even though I did take away I had great service while I waited. They immediately offered me water and even let me know the boba shop next door had my favorite smoothie.

Worst haircut I've ever received. Told her to trim the top and the side a 1, low fade. She decided to disregard my request and gave me a high fade, then butchered one side of my head. Had to go back to get it fixed and she cut the top super short and still left a bunch of long hairs and left my hair uneven. Been wearing a hat everywhere Tim my hair grows back a bit to fix it. I didn't want to go bald or really short.
Will never return here even if they gave me free hair cuts.
I gave myself better hair cuts in the military.

Was in town for New Year's and decided to check this place out. 

Food:
I've had better quality of fish but this was a cool place to try out; they had flying fish roe which I've never had before but don't think I'll come back just because there are places that have better fish for the same price. 

Service:
Sat at the sushi bar and ordered AYCE sushi for their lunch price. I'd recommend sitting at the bar so you can ask the sushi chef questions and give precise orders. They're very creative and accommodating; he gave us plates that we didn't order and all were pretty good! I made a custom order and he was able to make it for me, no problem. :)

Beautiful hotel!  We got a hook up through a promoter we know is Los Angeles and he got use the Terrace Suite for $450 for two nights!!!  When we got to the hotel, they asked if we wanted to upgrade to the Wrap Around Suite for $75 more a night.  We did and it was so awesome!  Our room litterally wrapped around the corner of the hotel and we were on the 17th floor.  Our room looked right over the pool and Marquee's outdoor bar.  The music started at like 9pm and was super loud, but you couldn't hear a thing if the door was shut.  The room was huge, 1200 square feet.  It only has one bed, but the couch was soooooo comfortable that my husband and I opted to sleep on it the second night too!  Staying at the hotel will not get you the hook up into Marquee though, maybe just in a different line.  I loved the Chandalier Bar and if you go, get the flower drink!!  Makes your damn face tingle and feels so crazy weird! The drink itself is really sweet though, but worth the $11 just for the flower you eat!  They have some pretty crazy drinks at that bar!  I also love that they chose to decorate the entire place with the theme of shoes :)   Overall a great experience and loved our room!!

This place is a little gem.  I have came here before for dinner with friends but today I decided to try this place for lunch since I was at a work meeting close by.  I ordered the Pollo Caprice today and I was told it would be ready in 25 min.  I got there on time and they greated me nicely and told me my order was ready.  My salad and hot food were packaged separately without having to ask.  Great service and great food.  Thanks Gabriel
Horrible. It WAS amazing when the old girls worked here. Won't be surprised if this place closes down in the next couple months.

The only reason they got 1 is the lack of 0 as an option. 

So I tried to order some togo tonight and the waiter on the line told me he cannot speak Chinese and asked me to order in English. I told him the translation is junky and asked (politely) if he can find a Chinese speaker to help me out - the guy insisted he was the only one there right now. I mean come on, a dim sum place with only one English speaking guy?! (really? On a weekday evening? No other waiters or waitresses around?!) and kept telling me Nani is an American Chinese restaurant and we are supposed to speak English. 

I then suggested them to upload Chinese menu or at least some pics to their online menu so to ease the ordering process, but got scoffed again by claiming this is an American Chinese restaurant and people suppose to read  the English menu.

Okay Nani, you are an authentic dim sum place with only English speaking people, I get it. Let me finish by quoting Stephen Chow,
??????????
??????????
??????????
???????menu????????????????????

???????

Nice small hidden gem place! Great place for weekend delicious bkft/brunch/lunch!

Will definitely come back again! Love the ambience setting of the resto!

I have been taking my dog to Heartsong for about 6 months. I can tell you that the place is awesome. The people are friendly and professional, the veterinarians are kind and amazing. I don't have the easiest dog to handle and they were very good with him.  I can't say enough good things about the care my dog got while he was there. Thumbs up! Great place to take your pets.

I used to eat in the restaurant here fairly often but it's kind of a hit and miss proposition. This place recently had a really bad review from the health department and I haven't been back since. 

Back when I was coming here with friends it seemed like the orders were frequently mixed up. Sometimes the food is great, other times not so good. If you go around dinner time expect a very long wait.

True, they have a cheap steak dinner but you can get something equal to or better at most of the casinos. 

Ellis Island used to have a nice outdoor BBQ restaurant. Then they moved it inside and it's a pain to get into. You have to arrive at a certain time and get a ticket out of a machine. The restaurant is so small that it fills up almost instantly.

I'd rather go to a big casino or regular restaurant where it's easy to park, you can get seated right away and no hassle to get some food. Sad to say, I won't waste my time or money here anymore.

Super dependable place to have jewelry repaired.  They also have a great selection of pre-owned jewelry!  I've had rings resized, watch links removed, inserted or repaired, missing diamonds replaced, and cleaning of intricate pieces done. Always received my jewelry back cleaned and polished, without even asking for them to do it.  The prices are reasonable, and the thing I like best about Edmar Fine Jewelry is that it is a family owned business and does not have a lot of uninterested employees working for it.  I always get a call from them when my piece is ready.  Edward is especially good with wristwatches -- he knows everything about them!  I think "curious g." had to be an aberration, because Edmar is consistently on top of their work. Marsha and Edward are very interesting people (old country) and I've had some great conversations with them.  I would highly recommend this jeweler to my family, friends and acquaintances, and I don't trust my fine jewelry with anyone else.

Called them for a tow and they were here in 20 mins.  From the first interaction with the Dispatcher (I believe his name is Jared, if not my apologizes) to the actual tow truck driver Pat was 6 star service!!  They were both amazing and very calming after all I've been waiting since 3 am for a tow truck to come and get my vehicle but as mentioned they were extremely fast, courteous and all around amazing customer service!  Come here for all of your towing needs!!  I will be sure to go thru them from here on out!!!  Keep up the great work!!

Grabbed a chicken only box for my husband. Got home, opened box and chicken had been cooked in old oil, very dark and crispy. Not the traditional, light golden breaded chicken I've enjoyed for over 20 yrs. never received a reply from customer complaint form that states you'd receive a phone call within 48 business hrs. Fair to say I'll stick with other locations and avoid Northfield Village.

We ate here for our last dinner in Vegas. Pretty standard Italian fare. Boy got the veal and I got the cannelloni. Nothing stood out which says something right there. The waiter was a bit frazzled because there was a large party next to us. The buffalo mozzarella crostini were the star of the meal.

I got the chocolate mousse for dessert. Light and airy, right? Wrong. This thing had the consistency of a brick and the temperature suggested it had been sitting in a fridge or freezer right before it was brought out. I ate maybe 3 bites before giving up.

Also, water wasn't free. You had to ask for it. Weird...

THIS PLACE IS SO CUTE. 

A turquoise gem in Kensington market, FIKA is treasure. Literally, this place place is bright in colour on the outside and bright with natural lighting on the inside.

I've been here for brunch on the weekends and it is also a tasty treat. The plates always look very pretty, like they know they're waiting to be photographed. I'd recommend a benny. 

It's slightly difficult to get a table out front, but they have a large communal table room in the back and some space outside. As far as #views go, any space is a score.
Lots of delicious hand made goodies here. Yum. Pleasant staff too.

The food is always fresh and made to order at Med Fresh. The portion sizes are huge which they should be since the prices are a little high. But they pile it on I like the Mixed Grill which includes chicken and some other meat, humus, pita bread, small salad, and rice. This plate usually lasts me for 2 meals but today I was exceptionally hungry and I ate it all gone. The staff is always friendly and the restaurant is always clean.
Excellent (but very small saloon) chinese restaurant for chinese pasta. Feels very authentic.

I am a repeat regular at this restaurant I made reservations about 6 days ago. This is my first review of this restaurant. The wine is good food is fantastic but it took our server 13 minutes to greet my girlfriend and I I requested a table by the window of Las Vehas Blvd since its Valentine's Day and I get sat in the back of the restaurant.... And yes I did request to be sat there on my reservations. Service could use some work. Also took my server about 15 minutes to just bring our drinks and the bread was cold... Other experience's were great but not this one... Also waited on our food for 30 minutes and other people who got here after us were getting their food before us.

I came to this outback location for the first time yesterday.. I will not be coming back. Our servers name was alyce and she was very nice and a great server..as for my meal..not so good. Our appetizer was way over cooked. My meal..well first off I wanted a medium steak n I got a well done steak. My crab legs were way over cooked. The meat was hard n dry. They gave me a new order of crab legs which was good. My bFs steak was over seasoned. His garlic mashed potatoes were over seasoned as well. But I put in a order to go...I literally waited 45 mins for it to be done. If it wasn't for my server being so nice n apologetic I would have just left.. But I will not be returning. And in the future if I do it won't be on Tuesdays bc the kitchen staff is horrible

A whiskey bar with smoked meats.... Need I say more? I think the Cleveland Cheese Steak is everyone's favorite and for a good reason. If you are going to go, go on Wednesdays. $10 for the cheesesteak and a beer, CANT BEAT THAT. 

Good luck eaters
SL

This is the BEST pizza I have ever had! On my last visit, I had their white and margherita pizza for lunch and dinner, I am THAT obsessed. When we sat down in the Cosmo lobby to eat our slices and opened the boxes, people started coming to us to ask where we got the pizza from. It smells delicious, looks delicious, and tastes way more delicious. Highly recommend and cant wait to go back!
Incredible tacos. I would usually tell people to hit up el grito but damn! These are amazing! Cant wait to go back and try different ones!

This place was so great! You walk in and feel at home!! The food was amazing! The head chef came out and just hung out with us. My order was off and they made me a whole other meal. With no charge! They were so kind even with us having a big group! I will definitely come back on the regular.

I thought I had already written reviews for both of the Cheesecake Factory locations we frequent the most.
Not very pleased lately, one of our most recent visits to this one I had a steak with a side of broccoli, sans the broccoli. My server never brought my side even after we brought it to her attention. 
And they did not even give us a discount or comp... 
We liked them very much in the past but we have not had the best experiences recently, both at Biltmore and North Scottsdale.

After following this company for over a year, I was so excited to FINALLY try a plate for my birthday. Unfortunately, I was greeted by the most rude cashier I've ever had the displeasure of encountering. This place is expensive, I paid $40 for one plate, I didn't mind the price but when you pair that with rude service it's simply unacceptable. I went for a special day, but left a bit let down with the service. The food was great, but I might have to figure out the secret sauce at home since I can't see myself paying for subpar service ever again.

My wife and I went to have lunch, and immediatelly we noticed our waitress had an attitude towards us, but mostly towards my wife, we couldn't put our finger on it, but she was rude and she wouldn't make eye contact, through out our entire stay, food was ok, nothing special, "over price¡¡, oh almost forgot, a lot of flies

I never post a review regarding my nails because there usually is always something wrong anywhere I go. One day I stopped in and I am so glad that I did. I found the best nail tech around at this salon...Hannah! She is fast but very detailed. I've been going to her for a few months now and my nails have never looked better. Never once have they lifted or chipped. She "nails" the shape everytime! I pay $30 for an acrylic fill with gel polish and they last me a good 3 weeks.
...been here many times...as with many places in Vegas best to experience first at lunch- which has great prices and food very good...dinner although first class is more than a tad pricey...enjoy
The most impressive thing outside of the culinary experience, is the staff knowledge and professionalism. 5 stars.

I come here about 2 times a week now for lunch and just love it! I adore the hot/cold options and have recently ventured to the cold prepared food section. I've sampled their samosas and they are just sooo delicious. They don't mind heating them up on site for lunch. 

I've also been digging their juices. It's all made using the produce section in store, so for ~$8, you're getting an organic juice made the moment you order it. 

The desserts are pretty decent too. I love their espresso cheesecake.

I just wish they would start to make sushi and then I'd be set!

This used to be my favorite place to go in Vegas. In fact, I would have rated it 5 stars just a year ago. However, the quality of the food has really gone downhill since then. 

I was here just a week ago, excited as usual to get my yummy tuna melt and holiday turkey sandwich to share with my sister. I noticed something as soon as I got the sandwiches, they were much smaller than usual. I have been to Earl's more times than I can count. I've been to both this location and the one in Downtown Disney. So I knew for sure that something was off. I just thought to myself "That's alright I guess, I don't need to be eating so much". Then I noticed that the sandwiches were barely toasted, in fact, the holiday turkey was almost white in color. What the hell? I took a bite of the tuna melt first. It was decent, but nowhere near as good as it used to be. There was definitely less cheese and it seemed drier than I remembered. The contents of the holiday turkey was still pretty good, but the bread just wasn't toasted enough. 

I'm just really sad that the quality of their product has gone down so much. I feel like whoever is higher up needs to realize that they are ruining their brand image by sacrificing the quality of their product for larger profit margins. Not sure if I really want to come back to this location unless there's a change.

Tanzy is in a real cool spot at the Q, right next to ipic, Salt, and Narcise. The look of this place is gorgeous, very modern and elegant, and feels like a lounge as well as a nice restaurant/bar.  The drinks are very delicious, and original. I'm not a huge fan of the food- overpriced salads and unsatisfying appetizers. They do have a Sunday  brunch that is worth checking out. Seems like they always have open seating, and they also have nice views.
Highly recommend Cranmore Carpet Cleaning.  They were on time, professional and did a great job!  A+

Brawley's is one of the few hidden gems in Charlotte. Sure you can buy decent beer at the grocery store or at the big box wine stores but here you get personal interaction, friendliness, and probably the best beer selection in all of Charlotte. If you're looking for a specific beer or a hard to find craft release Brawley's has it (or will help you get it.) The store space is feels small... because it's packed with beer! I'll never forget the first time I happened upon Brawley's Beverage about three years ago. My jaw hit the floor and my mouth watered when I saw brands of beer not to be had anywhere else, although now The Common Market has a good selection, but I digress. Behind the counter sat the owner himself, Michael Brawley. He seemed to personally know every customer that came in. It's that kind of store. We talked about beer, dogs, sailing, and Maine. Because of his friendliness and knowledge, I'm happy to drive twenty minutes to give him my cash! If you love beer, you'll love Brawley's Beverage.
The worst customer service as I called to order a tray for a house of mourning and they were unwilling to take the order over the phone.  Was told had to come in and place the order in person only

Saw mixed reviews but thought I would give them the benefit of the doubt and give them a try. Went in to order food to go. Ordering was a little different. No combos, need to order each item separately including cheese on your items.  Ordering went quickly as I was the only one on line. Ordered two tacos, rice, beans and a shrimp quesadilla for $22. Food came out  fast, 10 minutes later. Had to remind the waitress that the food was to go as it wasn't packed to go. Got home and realized they didn't put the cheese I paid extra for on my tacos. Tacos were good, even without the cheese. Overall food was just OK. However, I'm not feeling the whole experience for the price.
This complex is a wonderful place to stay!  Close to the strip and night life but also far enough to still enjoy Las Vegas without all the kaos.

We were so surprised not to have loved it!  After reading all of the wonderful reviews, we did not expect to be so underwhelmed.  The evening started out OK - we loved the building and overall atmosphere, so wine on the patio was a win.  Upon sitting down (which took 25 addt'l minutes, after the hostess called us in), we ordered the goat cheese and fingerling potatoes.  Both were fine, but nothing exciting.  The bread served w/the goat cheese was hard and five pieces for our group of four was weak.  I have done better fingerlings at home.  None of us were impressed with the entrees - extremely pork heavy, nothing popped.  The pot roast sandwich was heavy and diner-esque, the citrus salad was tiny, the cauliflower flat bread was colorful, but lacked flavor and the ahi tuna sandwich would have even been a little disappointing had I been eating lunch at a resort restaurant.  I am sorry to be so harsh, especially when I am definitely in the minority, but St. Francis did not live up to the sexy building it inhabits, nor the hype.  I gave it a three, because the patio was great and I would go back for a drink - BEFORE heading somewhere else to eat.

Best wings in Vegas, don't @me. They have a ton of different flavors, so I'll definitely be back soon. I had the Jamaican jerk and the mango habanero and both were amazing. I also got to try the apple bbq and they were superb as well. They had a nice atmosphere and a very friendly wait staff, as well as live music which was really cool

The food was extremely authentic compared to what I've had in Beirut. The baba ganoush, kefta, and beets were all very delicious. The service was a bit slow and clunky, but if you're not in a rush and like Lebanese cuisine, this is a perfect spot.

This place just literally gave me a canceled ordered! I was wondering why the super nachos were done in less then 5 mins. I asked for no pico, got home full of pico, soggy nachos... cold! 

Don't come to this place unless you like someone's canceled food or whoever's food this was!!

Best pierogi in town but most bizarre menu and service. Good dill pickel soup.  I have been in here several times and the buffet is always set up with cold food. That's usually your only option. On occasion there is a waitress working but most of the time you walk in to just people eating. Once they announced they were closing only to open up again a few months later. Once, I ordered a 6 dollar pierogi dinner and the waitress told me to go to the buffet and get what I wanted. Then they charged me 14 bucks. Once I ordered Kraut pierogi only to be told to call ahead if you want them. Then they bring you schnitzel and soup and a dessert which, when I asked what it was, the waitress, in a thick accent, replied "kook-ees."
I understand that if you go there on a Friday night, that's when you can actually order off the menu and they have everything. 
Best of luck!

With an appointment for an oil change they have me waiting over 2 hours already.  Will not return here if they can't provide scheduled appointment.  People with appointment should be taken first not wait in line as non scheduled ones.
Service manager came out and apologized for the long wait time and explained how Toyota must do a  complete 
Check up which is bonus to let one know if additional service might be needed.  So his explanation was appreciated.   I will return !

Did not receive the 30 minute "heads up" call as promised. They expected to be paid a service fee even with no service (we decided to decline based on the amount of the quote and the technician saying we needed parts even though we already had the whole install kit).
