The guy on the phone was rude and threatening when I tried to clarify what was expected. Don't fall for their scare tactics.

I've had my hair cut by Anita and other stylist at Shear Synergy Salon, IMHO, Anita does not seem to know how to cut men's hair, they may cut female hair ok, based on what I hear from my female friends but for men, Anita shaved my back hair so much that, Ouch ! it made me look like a little kid lol.
They have consistently under perform even If I showed them the photos (front, side and back). To be fair, I've tried other hair-stylist and she still could not cut to my satisfaction. On top of that Anita has a very unprofessional attitude and racist towards her Asian customer (me). I've asked my friend who is not Asian and does not have thick hair and he have said the same thing to me. Very unsatisfactory cut. Don't forget that they charge you hefty $35 and already included ($3 tips) and of course without telling you and without saying "thank you", not the honest people that I've met when I went to this hair salon and their customer service skill is poor. They need to polish on their customer service skill, before they are allowed to even cut customer's hairs.

The Apple Soup is DELICIOUS!

I went for lunch yesterday and was completely underwhelmed by everything but this soup. I have no idea how often they have it (it happened to be the soup du jour), but seriously people, if it's on the menu, GET IT! You will not be disappointed...it's almost like a cross between apple cider and apple sauce, very smooth, and it still has a sweetness to it, but with a little kick that you wouldn't expect.

I know it sounds strange, but you won't be disappointed!!

Casual dining, reasonable prices, friendly service, and great food!  If you don't fill up on the homemade salsa, guacamole and tortilla chips, try the Crusted Cod in a bowl with creamy beans and coconut rice!  As we say in Hawaii "broke da mouth!"  My friends also enjoyed the green chile chicken burrito and skirt steak tacos. Check it out!

Timo bread is so fluffy! Dangerous for sure. The patio was nice and cool with the misters. Sam had all the inside info on the bruschettas and wine. Loud inside with the bachelorette party, quiet and very pleasant outside.
Terrible,good for nothing, too closing early pieces of trash. Your work ethic and attention to detail is insulting. Hope you're further has numerous discomforts and hardships.
Very professional and personable tattoo artist handled matching fibro ribbon tattoos with great results very pleased and happy. Recommend Kings for any tattoo needs
I've frequented this restaurant often. Today I enjoyed lunch with a glass of Badiola wine ($7)and their Eggplant Parmigiana (battered eggplant slices with mozzarella and marinara sauce), for $8.

I became a huge Richardsons fan since the first day I ate there back in 1998. I've been a follower of all his food/restaurant concepts throughout all these years. I love going to Rokerij's dimly lit bar in the basement on a Sunday morning while devouring my Enchiladas and Eggs. I always get the same dish every time, but its like a party in my mouth with every bite. I've also come here for their great happy hour specials. How can anyone pass up $5 small dishes, which honestly are not small at all. No one will ever be disappointed with the outstanding customer service, food, drinks, and cozy environment that Rokerij has to offer. 

P.S. Remember to always make reservations for diner.

We have been going to Scottsdale for the past six years. This was absolutely the most fun that we've had. It is a terrific way to see old town Scottsdale as well as the neighboring areas in Parks. Customer;Service was awesome

I would like to start my review by saying that I really did love this place to a fault at one time. I've had many piercings and a tattoo through them, and recommended them to many people over the past ten years. I even had a great experience with a piercing less than a month ago.

Unfortunately tonight that changed quite a bit. I went with my partner to get tattooed, and we decided to go later. Since the main location closes at 6, we ended up at their new second location. I was impressed with how clean it was, just like the first.

Having been told that neither location books appointments on weekends, and its first come first serve, when we arrived at the second one at 5:30pm we were told that the artist already there was booked up until he was to leave at 8:00, but another artist was coming in at 6:30, had no appointments and could take both of us for tattoos. We milled about for an hour and came back.

My partner decided to go first, so he got his tattoo, and the artist was wonderful. She did a great job, and everything was very clean. As he gets up from his tattoo, the artist begins to set up for the next slot, at around 9:45ish and mentions that a girl who has come in while he was being tattooed has an appointment, so could I wait around? At this point I was a little upset, but I asked how long it would be, and was told her tattoo was much smaller than mine, and should be only about 30-45 minutes.

We go for dinner, and come back in 45 minutes, at 10:30/10:45 pm. We wait... We wait some more... Never once was I told that it would be a lot longer than the time suggested, which should have been now.

Finally, at 12:00 midnight, I decided it was time to stop waiting. The tattoo that was put ahead of me was no where near done.

I apologized and said I couldn't wait any longer having been there for 6 hrs, and was offered a small discount... Unfortunately, I'll be booking an appointment somewhere else, and won't be going back to use it. It seemed to me no one really cared that I'd waited for 6 hours and gotten nowhere, while someone's friend who had an "appointment" that wasn't in the book got done...

The worst part is, that two of us went there tonight to get tattooed together, and one person had an amazing experience, while the other left extremely disappointed, sad and angry... Recreating the experience is not exactly something we can just go do next weekend, or some other time.

That's not the experience I expected or wanted to have, but it's what I got.

I've ordered from this place several times and each and every time they are consistently delicious and friendly. Thank goodness they're around! The pastrami sandwich is the greatest and my husband loves their veggie wrap and potato salad. I will recommend this establishment to everyone!

This was seriously sooooo disappointing.  I was responsible for picking this restaurant in the new, gorgeous casino/hotel Aria and I did so based upon Yelp reviews.  You people let me down!!!  

Not only was the food pretty terrible but the service was horrendous.  I booked a reservation (which we clearly didn't need since 9/10ths of the restaurant was empty...not a good sign!) at 7:45pm to make it to a 10pm for the Cirque de Soliel show at Bellagio, "O".  Needless to say, we had to run there after the final touch of the bad experience:  the waiter disappeared for about 30 minutes.  

We ordered the shellfish appetizer and both my friend and I specified we wanted it cold.  It arrived hot.  And when we sent it back, the waiter came and told us we ordered it hot.  Um, cardinal rule of serving is that you don't tell your customers they are wrong.  (I'm very new to shellfish and I've only had it cold so there was no memory confusion here, folks.)  

So pretty much that set the tone for the whole meal.  They have a fantastic cocktail menu that he never offered us until I asked...although the cocktails we ordered were far from the best.  

The entrees were disgusting.  I ordered the Salmon with some sort of soup they poured over it which had a predominate taste of salt.  The salmon was very rare--almost sushi.  Bleech.  I can't remember, unfortunately what my friend had but she gave me an "ick" face too.  

I should have stopped eating but the portions were so small I wanted dessert...so I ordered chestnut ice cream.  How can you go wrong with ice cream?  Well, it tasted like chalk.  

It ended up being about $125 each...wayyyyy too much for that crappy customer service and that lackluster of food.  There are so many great restaurants in this town...don't let what must be the friends and family of the owners convince you with just a handful of reviews to eat at this place.  

It's been two weeks and I still have a bad taste in my mouth!!!

Just came back from dinner with my wife at Maroli, and we both enjoyed it immensely. Not a deep menu, but very good food, fresh, well-prepared, home-made chutneys, and attractive presentation in an updated dining room. Friendly, efficient staff. Most of the clientele appeared to be from the Indian sub-continent, and seemed very happy to be there.

Excellent! The bacon dates in fois gras were amazing! Everything was perfectly balanced. The sumo salad, ramen, mushroom and Korean beef tacos were also great. I wouldn't recommend the tempura cod taco, it kind of fell flat with too much mayo. The decor is fun and fresh, and the overall flavored unique and exciting.

Out of the many acts that performed on the stage, only two were truly spectacular: Elvis and Christina Aguilara.  Apparently Michael Jackson impersonators can no longer perform on the strip (when I went, but he appears to be back); the rest of the cast included Tim McGraw, Britney Spears and Rod Stewart.

For a show that is never found on the locals free ticket circuit, this theater was amazing full.  I do know they give a lot of free tickets away at the hotel itself (or 2 for 1) so you can find deals to check the show out.  Most all of the seating is in either a booth or table format, so if you sit at the front of the table, you will have to turn around to view the show.

The Elvis impersonator did win the best Elvis in the world competition a few years back; he's quite good.  The Christina Aguilara impressionist may not have the looks of the real thing (though very close), she does have the chops.  

If you can find a good deal on the show, check it out.  I wouldn't take the kids (little risque with Britney and "X-tina") but couples will enjoy a night out with the "superstars" of America.

I love VS! This store always has the best selections. So... I purchased a jacket at mall of America when I was on vacation in a size small. I saw that this location has a size extra small. I had already ripped the tags off and did not have the receipt. The store manager, Melissa, was very friendly and did the even exchange for me even without tags and a receipt. Excellent customer service!!! :) Also, the free panty coupons are a plus.
Amazing work every time!  I've been here on 3 separate occasions and each time I have been wowed by your great service and excellent work. Thank you for bringing my shoes back to life!
Great place for business lunch or dinner.  Favorite was the swordfish topped with crush almonds and sliced red grapes (served with rapini and black tiger rice). Best patio in the downtown core.

Great food and amazing service!  We come here so often that they already know our order as soon as we step foot in the door. Haha it's safe to say we are regulars here. But they have a great selection on the menu. Definitely worth a try, guys!

Was very disappointed coming to this location expecting Paradise bakery only for it to be a Panera. The menu is not a Paradise menu and all the paper products they provide say Panera on them. If your coming to this location expecting a Paradise it's not :(

So I've kind of got a bone to pick with Ciro's. 

When I moved into the Bloordale neighbourhood last summer, away from my favourite neighbourhood of Little Italy, and its neighbouring Kensington Market, into a more affordable situation, it's an understatement to say I was a little bummed. 

But I wanted to give my new neighbourhood a chance, and along with the Value Village, Wal-Mart and all of its cheap necessities being ten minutes away, Holy Oak and Three Speed, I was getting pretty stoked on it. 

I kept seeing Ciro's and one night my friends and I decided to check it out after I'd read up on it online. And what a surprise! It was dark, cozy (romantic even), lit with tiny candles on the tables, and the back patio was a delight during the summer months. HOWEVER, on my third or so visit, I ordered two Strongbows off the menu. The menu stated that a tall can of Strongbow was $6.75, which is a little pricey, but fairly regular. We finished our drinks and got up to pay our bills. I read my bill and for a second things seemed alright until I abruptly realized that the bill of about $18.00 for two $6.75 Strongbows seemed outrageous, and though I never do say anything, I politely asked why it was so expensive. The waiter (who we'd had before and is extremely charismatic and talkative) faltered, and became awkward all of a sudden, before mumbling that they'd forgotten to change the price on the menu. I paid, and still tipped, but was furious. It's just this kind of thing -- places trying to take advantage of their customers in little ways like this -- really irks me and happens too often. It's also against the law, if you really want to get nick-picky and down to it. I swore I'd never go back to Ciro's again.

And I didn't... until about three months later when I was severely hungover and it was cold and my roommate went to get a burger. I tried to go somewhere else, but it was closed! So I went to get a coffee, and I decided to order a side of fries. The side of fries was huge! So generous, and the fries were crispy and thick. It was something like $4.00 which is pretty cheap for a restaurant side of fries where the plate is basically exploding. So Ciro's redeemed itself that day a little bit for me.

It's a toss-up. I love the look of the place, and it's close to me, and they do have a wide variety of beers and drinks to choose from. In the summer, it's gonna be really hard to resist their quiet, cozy back patio. So maybe I'll keep going there, I'll just have to double-check the prices of all the drinks I'm ordering as I go.

My wife and I came here before heading out for dinner reservations.  We had a great appetizer plate with cheeses, grilled bread, preserved fruit, and other really good things.  We also had some local (Arizona and New Mexico) wines that were quite good.  The service, however, was the best--  Everyone was very attentive, but not too obtrusive, and very friendly.  I'll go back for dinner when in town again.

Trying to make an offer on a house and you can't even get someone to answer the phone - let alone get a long recording that tells you to text them and then no one messages you back all day.  Which is shocking considering the house has been sitting... maybe that explains why... most people probably have to go with a different property while they are waiting for a response!

Great salon, great haircut and style with the friendly and artistic Biz!  Thanks for making my day better.  :) 

She gave a great shampoo and even rubbed my neck during the conditioning!  Listened to what I wanted for my haircut and took extra time styling it.  If you are in Vegas and near Mandalay Bay, take the time to go visit Biz at the Robert Cromeans Salon, you won't regret it!

Worst food ever! 
I just spoke with the "chef" to give him feedback, his response- "don't order again, we don't need your business".
You know the saying 'pizza is like sex, even when it's bad it's still kinda good' well this place has proven that wrong.
Inedible pizza, wings and garlic knots.
I've never been so disappointed with food.
Don't waste your time!

We will make this a regular visit every time we come to Vegas! Great food, amazing music, friendly service. Mark was great! I will recommend this place to all my friends. Keep up the good work Herbs & Rye! Xo- Jessica, Jenny, Don & Felix

I am a definite foodie. This is one of the best places I have been to for brunch. The Chorizo hash is some of the best Choriozo I have ever tasted the fact that there is jalapenos cooked into the hash and they serve it with potatoes and just a side note that you can request a tortilla in place of the biscuits. The drink with the watermelon is delicious as well as the drink that is like a mimosa but better. 

The only reason I gave it a 4 star rating versus a 5 star rating is because we had a 2 1/2 hour wait. while they were letting other groups in we continued to wait.

This is by far one of my favorite restaurants in the area. Fresh, delicious and healthy! How can you go wrong...you can't. I've been here several times and have always received top notch friendly service coupled with great food. I order the chicken hot bowl with a spinach base, sichuan sauce (spicy), tomatoes, garbanzo beans, tofu and mushrooms...it's a flavorful power packed combo.

With it getting harder and harder to find healthy choices (especially for those monitoring their diet for training purposes) and solutions I'm grateful Fresh Millions is right around the corner for lunch or dinner!

With over 1000 reviews for this place, there really isn't much I can add about the food. I love that they have gluten free bread and buns. The food was so much better than I expected... well seasoned and good temp. 

The part that I'm just super intrigued about is the unisex bathrooms. I like the idea of unisex bathrooms anyway... but these individual stalls were so well designed...

I have a digestive disease so bathrooms are important to me. Haha

I like that they have individual stalls with music and artwork and each has its own in and out vents and vacant notices on the door versus knocking... it's probably the best bathroom set up I've seen.

Finally got to try this place.

Verdict: hot dogs were as plain as you can get, tasted just like a plain ol' Nathan's hot dog. I got the Vegas strip dog which had two hot dogs in one bun + mustard + ketchup + chili + cheese + guacamole + jalapeños. Basically they serve a plain hot dogs with various junk you can add on top. 

The fries were really good though. Perfect level of crispiness on the outside and fluffiness on the inside.

One other downside is that this place only has an outdoor patio for seating.

Your drink will be good but they are about as slow as Christmas. Almost missed my flight and my oatmeal with milk looked like soup. Just skip it, get pastry and drink or plan ahead that even though you are third in line you are no where close to being next.

Amazing service! I've been here twice and Oscar (the owner) is always on it. I don't usually write Yelp reviews but I was so impressed that I had to. I highly recommend using their services and would choose them over all the other body shops I've used in Phoenix.

I have always loved any show that is put on by Cirque du Soleil. These guys really know what they're doing.

The whole entire experience here was extremely sexual and stimulating. TALK ABOUT SENSORY OVERLOAD! The creators really have a way of pulling you in at the very moment that you walk into the door. There are scantily clad women walking around with whips and chains and slithering about sexy boudoirs. I felt like a kid in a candy store and wanted to touch EVERYTHING. I attention never wavered during the show. There's this really awesome bathtub scene that I somehow wish I could recreate in my own home ahaha! 

Really sad to see only 4 stars here. I truly thought that this show was fantastic. Highly recommended!

1st time today and it won't be my last. The first thing you notice as you walk in is the warm and welcoming vibe this place has, even at peak lunch hour. Yes it was noisy, yes it was full but welcome to the big city. The host found us a seat immediately and was pleasant. It had been a while since I had  gone out with this particular friend so we kept neglecting to look at the menu. Luckily the server was extremely patient and extremely cute but I digress. The menu though busy in lay out was EASY to master. Unfortunately there were no THAI OMELETTES left so I went with my staple PANANG BEEF and we ordered spring rolls to start. FAST and EFFICIENT! Beer was perfectly cold, the spring rolls were cooked well with very little grease and had a spicy kick to them. My main course (beef panang) was rich and creamy and oh so delicious. Coffee was perfect and the glutinous rice dessert with mango hit the sweet tooth spot without going into diabetic coma. All in all...,a wonderful spot to eat and be merry. No pressure to leave, we lingered for a bit....don't worry we ordered things....we aren't cheap lol. I say go and try it out. Plus the staff are so very sweet, kind AND attractive lol

GREAT THAI! 

However the uptown prices prevent me from giving them more stars

Live the Pad Thai. Coconut soup. Ginger chicken. Red Curry. Spring Rolls. And Thai Wings

Visited on a Thursday night in November.  We got a table in the bar.  Tacos and margaritas were very good.   They charge for chips and salsa, which is pretty weak.  Only complaint is that service was a little slow given that the place was not that crowded.  

Diablo's was just OK for our dinner.  I'm sure it would be more fun on a busy summer weekend.

The Bay is gigantic and you can get some pretty sweet deals during their Bay Days.

I'm a big fan of the convenience of the location (connected to the Eaton Centre). It's directly above the Queen subway station and can be accessed via the PATH.

The store is currently going through some major renovations so it might be confusing navigating the place.

Tip for men: new men's section is on the 5th floor. My favourite is TopMan.

Electronic reservation kiosk is a sham, they just want you to walk around and gamble / drink. When you get there put your name in and get in line, no point to come back at your assigned time as you still must wait in the exact same line.

Food is pretty solid, just make sure to get the high value items such as crab legs. Don't waste precious stomach space on stuff like pizza.

Key thing to note: steamed crab legs are in the back and you get a giant plate. Don't get totally distracted by the chilled ones in front (although they are good as well)

Desert table has some high value items such as macaroons and gelato.
My favorite place for incredible menu and buffet. Always served quickly and the price is amazing for the quality. I've been to others and this by far is the best .

This is my first time eaten at this place for Maisel am my employees enjoyed every bit of your food we had a good time we will spread of words to our friends and our neighbors and our business nearby and we will generate our business bigger and bigger if we spread words aroundYour Italian cooking style is good and Best We will see you soon

Attention Attention Attention please do not get your loan from cash time.  They gonna take your car even if you do a personal loan.  If they take you car forget about your car the fees to get your car back it's crazy high they apply all kind of fees.  Please stay away from cash time loan. My loan amount was $300 After i made several payment to get my car back i had to 170% of original loan amount I had to pay $505 + the payments I made.  Please think twice befr you go to cash time loan.

Party of 4 on a Monday evening.  Busy but not too crazy.  Like the open kitchen layout.

I went in knowing exactly what I wanted --- the famous beef wellington.  It takes 45 minutes to prepare.  I asked if I could order that as soon as we got seated, but the server told us that the chefs request everything ordered together.  

The server brings by raw samples of all the cuts, which is quite impressive.

Started off with some bread, which was delicious.  Warm, crispy, a couple of different varieties --- personal fav was the one with pancetta baked in.

Started off with the pork belly appetizer, which was phenomenal.   For our group, we each probably got 1.5 bites, so it's not a huge portion, but sufficient for a taste.

Then we got our steaks.  No complaints from anyone.  The wellington was amazing ---  filet mignon medium rare inside that incredible pastry crust.  I watched a bunch of Youtube clips on how Ramsay makes it, and I almost expected to be disappointed given my insanely high expectations.  Nope.  Surpassed it.  Every bite was moist and flavorful (and again, it's filet mignon, which often has no taste if not done right).

We were way too full for dessert.  Fantastic meal, great location, friendly servers.  Probably a lifetime top 3 steak for me.

If you want to shop at a place where you're treated like it's a privilege for you to shop there, go to Sears on Grand Canyon in Las Vegas. If the higher ups that care about their brand know how their retail staff treat customers, especially about 2 or more hours to close, and are OK with it, deserve to lose a lot more business than just mine.
Awesome must see!! It's entertaining from beginning to end. It absolutely amazing, you're in aw the whole time. He's really great with the audience, and has a great sense of humor.

I called last week set the appointment for 0800 so that I could go to work by 0900.  The person on the phone had me read the order by my physician and kindly explained the exam.  I showed up at 0745 (as instructed) completed the two page paperwork, was in the exam room by 0755.  Out the door at 0805. -- Wow, my employer was thrilled that I got to work 1/2 earlier than I said.  The technician was great.  The mammogram test can be intimidating and certainly isn't comfortable, but her kind manner and directness was appreciated.

Found this spa on a business trip when I had to be out of town over the weekend and was badly in need of a massage.  I made an appointment for a massage and facial. I was able to call on Sunday morning and get a same day appointment.  The services were both phenomenal. All of the staff members were attentive and courteous.  Highly recommend this gem in a nondescript strip mall.

Starting taking our new Great Dane puppy there for her vaccines. They have been awesome and are very good about looking her over and making sure she has nothing wrong with her. They found some noise in her one rear leg and when we went back in today they checked again to make sure it was better and it was. They have been great and I would recommend anyone to go there.

We had the most unfortunate experience this morning at Angela's kitchen. Seven of us came for breakfast for my mom's birthday. They live in Sun City Grand and apparently the only reason Angela's kitchen survives is because there aren't any other choices besides Coco's. Let me start out by saying the server was very nice and did her best to keep our water and tea glasses filled for the 1 1/2 hours we sat on the patio waiting for our food. When it finally came out, my dads eggs were green from being over cooked or sitting under the lamp for too long, mom's omelet looked like it had been sitting under the lamp for an hour. My sister and nephew ordered at the same as everyone else, but his came out 10 minutes after and my sisters waffle came after EVERYONE was finished with their meal. Let alone that we asked for them to open up the patio shades a couple times and they wouldn't because ANGELA wasn't ready to open them yet. After my sister finished her waffle while we all sat and stared at her, they brought the bill and didn't even credit the waffle or my nephew's meal. My dad went in to speak to a manger and apparently ANGELA, said she wouldn't credit any of the meal because the server explained it would be late after everyone else received their meal. I would say ANGELA needs to take a class on customer service and go back to business school (that's if she went in the first place). 

ONE OF THE WORST EXPERIENCES I'VE EVER HAD FOR BREAKFAST. 

STEER CLEAR OF ANGELA'S KITCHEN AND ANGELA.

Make sure that you double check how much these guys are charging you. I know they probably need the extra money because it's a new business but it shouldn't be ok the buyers behalf. I was charged $47 for 3 drinks when I confronted them about i was told I was charged for an extra double shot drink in which I did not order.

Loved it!

We had a very energetic and knowledgeable tour guide - Bill. He was packed with all the history one could ask for and was patient with everyone taking pictures.

Would highly recommend and will do again next time I'm in town!

The doctor seems like he just rolls out of bed and comes to work. Likes to prescribe antibiotics to patients who don't need it hoping to fix the issue. Good thing I use a new doctor now. Don't waste your time people. I have awesome insurance and still had a $400 balance when I was only looked at for 2 minutes. SCAM SCAM SCAM!

I stopped in here a few months ago and love it!  Jen is fabulous and helpful, and they truly love the dogs!  They are not pushy at all and that is probably because their products and foods are great and their prices are competitive if not better than the other stores.  And my dogs love the frozen pup cups!  She is really passionate about her business and you can tell as soon as she starts talking to you, totally worth trying out!
Bah! Je n'ai pas apprécié mon repas. Je n'y retourne pas

This swanky restaurant boasts to be delicious, modern, & hip! It's true- the ambience is very chill & relaxed with waiters rocking their Converse shoes & edgy attire & the waitresses  sporting cat-eye eyeliners & trendy blouses. The music is amazingly appropriate, but it's the food that must be raved about.  From their Arnold Palmer drink to their pairings of beer with the right pizza, this is what it's all about.  Start to finish, everything that came out of the kitchen and onto our table was nothing short of delicious. The pizza crust was phenomenal  crunchy and just the right size. Everything we ate looked very inviting.

This place-by far- is my favorite pizza place!

Don't go here if you need to do something quickly or have business other than simple banking.

Stood in line for 30 minutes needing to do a wire tranfer only to find I needed to make an appointment. Only one teller with at least 10 people in line and building mid morning.

 No customer service.

I like the fact that they focus on Katsu and not spreading themselves thinly by having too many things on the menu. If you are looking for a good katsu/cutlet dish, this is the place you want to come. As simple as that. Good service, nice ambiance, good food!

Summary: Very good customer service at a small station across from the Texas Station. 

I called 30 minutes before closing asking about getting a car smogged. They answered my questions and  then did the unthinkable......the representative offered to stay open late so I could make it there and get smogged that day. I was prepared to come back the next day and even gave the employee an opportunity to retract his offer to stay open past closing for me. 

Needless to say, they stayed open for me and then proceeded to demonstrate professionalism and customer concern for the duration of my visit. 

The smog check is $14. If you don't pass, come back and they charge $10. 

I'm sure they don't want folks asking them to inconvenience them, and I won't again, but I certainly appreciate a place that cares enough about my business to make the effort.
My go to store for bras. I am not a standard fit and they always have my size and started my daughter there as well.

Amazing. 5stars EVERY TIME!  Best burger in Phx, and we've tried a LOT...  Chicken ala King and Queen is delicious. Can't go wrong w apps like hush puppies, shrimp n gritcake and the stand out friend green tomatoes. Personal and friendly service on top of great food!??!!  A Phoenix GEM!!!!

Love bulk shopping however no matter what time a day it is, this place is nuts. Way too busy, some customers hold a self entitlement, literally have been hit by carts and people, and way over due to build another Costco in close proximity. Yes this Costco banks on the traffic and dollar amount but dang, a pain to deal with.
The food was entirely too hard and crispy... not good for anyones teeth. But the food was served pretty fast and the cashier had manners

My husband and I had a small wedding in vegas recently and instead of having a reception, we decided to have our reception dinner here. I made reservations for 25 people a month a head of time so they could be prepared. I called a couple days before to confirm as well.  They had our table ready when we got there but took almost 2 hours to get our food out. For 25 people we only 1 server and 1 that would occasionally come. When our food came out it was cold and took forever! We book ahead so they can be prepared with the staff needed and I don't feel like they prepared for such a big party like they should have. 
The food was good and the restaurant was very nice, I was just disappointed that they were not prepared and for a big party, they only had one server. Such a bummer. I'd go back, just wouldn't have a big party with me next time.

Great Mediterranean place! When I was attending UNLV for my Master's I drove past this Establishment daily. Decided to give it a try--and it was great!  In fact, I have been there multiple times since. I prefer this location to their other location in W. Las Vegas. It is more authentic, in my experience.

The highlight of Paymon's is definitely their deserts. Their kataif and baklava are out of this world. I like their salads as well. The atmosphere inside the restaurant is great--I like the dim lit place with Mediterranean paint on walls. The staff is always friendly and although this restaurant is usually packed--the staff remains engaged and not overly stressed.

The only draw back--I am not very fond of their Greek dishes here. Some of the hot dishes are not necessarily bad, just bland and average. But, I usually try to go for the usual--baba ghanoush, humus, pita as appetizers and salads as entrees, and am very satisfied.

After hours dining happens at the adjacent huka lounge, which has a very ethnic atmosphere without much smoke permeating the air. It is not overcrowded either, unless you come on a Saturday night.

I recommend this place for affordable Mediterranean place. Don't forget to try the deserts and the Fatoush salad!

P.S. The adjacent Mediterranean market is awesome! I love all the ethnic foods I can pick up there for very affordable prices!

I have lived here the past 3 years. The office staff is very friendly. Its a great location. It's off a busy street, so there's some traffic noise but not bad. The floor plans are great and the master bedroom (in the 2 bed/2 bath) has a HUGE closet!!!

I have used Flowers by Michelle on a number of occasions to send flowers and I have always been happy with the service, beauty, and price of the arrangements.  We also used them for our wedding and were very happy with them throughout the process.  They worked with us on multiple occasions to help narrow down exactly what we wanted and were great through the process.  We looked at a number of florists around town and felt that for the money we got the most value from Flowers by Michelle.  We were not disappointed and I plan to order many more flowers from them for years to come.

The place is not fancy at all, but the food is fantastic. The staff and homey interior will make you feel like you're having dinner amongst friends. The food never disappoints, with extremely authentic Japanese curries and comfort foods, with some interesting twists of their own. Expect a heavy meal though, this is not light eating!

This place is really cool, very nice place, good vibe. The staff is really nice. Food was pretty good, we liked it mostly because it is unique, not because it is great. We'll go again, mostly to try the desserts!

This is a great all you can eat spot! Reasonably priced for good quality sushi.

Note: they didn't charge us extra when we left 6 pieces of sushi behind.

Couldn't figure out what I wanted, so I ordered a whole bunch of different items.  They were all delicious, but the most unusual was the milkshake.  If you go to this restaurant, you should order their milkshake.  I've had my share of milkshakes, but their milkshakes are incredible!
The food and service was fantastic! Very fresh and quality ingredients. We will definitely be back.

I wish that I could give this fitness club 0 stars but that is unfortunately not an option.

I'm extremely disappointed by this gym. I have been a member for two and a half years now, and things have only gotten worse there, despite emails from management claiming they are address issues. 

There are rarely towels in the men's locker room. Most of the lockers do not lock, or are always locked (even when no one is in the gym). This has been an ongoing problem for at least 6 months, with more lockers just getting broken over that time. The showers are disgusting. You can see build up in them, there are frequently bugs in them, and there is rarely soap to use. On multiple instances, both in the morning, and the evening, there has been no hot water! The ceiling leaks in both the men's room, and on the main fitness area, but there's generally a bucket there to catch it. There are several TV's mounted on the wall through the gym. But you won't be able to watch them, because they are never on! 

The management charges a $30 "enhancement fee" every year, but things just keep getting worse. They just keep spending money on stupid things like IV therapy and cosmetic procedures instead of focusing on the gym itself.

When you try to cancel the membership, they require 30 day notice, just to scam you out of one extra payment. 

For the monthly price of this gym, there are many other options in the area for the same price or even cheaper.

The OMC sign out front boasts a pretty bold claim of best burgers in town.  Now, as a person that crafts his own burgers (to perfection I might add) I like to think that I have a pretty decent handle on what it takes to build a proper burger.

Unfortunately my first impression of the burger menu wasn't great.  For 'The best burgers in town' their burger menu is really lacking.  Now, having said that the online menu actually has about 8 beef and 8 chicken burgers, not bad.  When I was there however I only found 2 beef burgers.  Not sure if this is an update to the menu or if it was a different lunch menu, but it seems they've added a few options now.

I ordered the banquet burger with spicy fries.  The burger itself was a little dry.  Certainly nothing about it would make me think it was the best in town (and certainly didn't compare to my own)  But, all in all and for the price, it wasn't too bad.  The actual cafe itself had kind of a cool atmosphere and prices were really reasonable, so I may give it another chance some time

Edit:  Well now I"m really confused the website actually shows a different address, and that explains the different menu.  Have they moved?

It's ok for a gas station. I usually stop in for a soda or some type of drinks or to top off when i'm cali-bound. The store is usually kept up for the most part. The employees range from good to bleh, depending on the time you stop in. Other than that it's about average for a gas station, I have been to both swanky and shady gas stops so this place is kind of inbetween. Good to grab your fuel and be on your way.

Awesome team, they help you with a great smile, Garett in plumbing was super nice saved me money by showing me how to get it done from A to Z and recommending best tools to do so, definitely my best store.

Good burgers, friendly staff, plenty to drink and even had a girl tell me she wanted to grab my butt (patron, not bar staff)...so how can I rate this place anything less than a 5??? LOL! Love Jack's, great people, all the games on the many different screens and an outdoor patio for the spring/summer/fall seasons. Love it!

Monica really pays attention to detail. She asks questions, runs her fingers through your hair a bit to know its texture, looks at your face shape, and makes sure she knows how you usually handle your hair before she begins. She is very quick, precise, incredibly sweet, and among all things, affordable. I've paid double for lesser quality cuts and styles. You will not be disappointed!

The products that come from this company are amazing.  But the problem is... the CEO of the company got forced out by his two partners.... and he is the only one with the skill and the ability to make the product!  Now, all the company is doing is accepting money on their website from unsuspecting buyers... and scamming them.  Wasting their time, when they know they cannot even get a pipe to anyone anymore since they do not have any stock of them, and they no longer have the designer and creator of the pipes working with them!!!!  It is all pretty ridiculous... DO NOT send them your money.  You won't see it, or you will have to be in long fights with them to get it back.... and you will never see a pipe.

Wait a while.  Because I am sure I will find out where to go for beautiful pipes like these.  And I will update this review to tell you where to go!

Nice sushi, nice appetizers. Nice service and comfortable surroundings.

Close to shopping area and whole foods. Easy parking. And group-friendly!

Good choice for multi-cultural gatherings.

Comfort Food, waffles, fried chicken, great breakfast, ice cream, sweets and even a salad ;)

PROS: food quality, originality, fast efficient service, very tasty, they go out of their way to help. You get the feeling they r glad u came.


CONS: not many vegitarian choices, if on a diet, just have a protein drink, n apple n keep walking. Don't even stop

I fell in love with this place . They were open on Saturday till 800pm!! And the guy that did my nails was very gentle because I told him I had thin nails . He helped me with the color and adding beautiful Swarovski crystal. Everyone there that is staff showed great hospitality.

I definitely enjoyed my visit here -- lots of trails, gorgeous fall colors (visited in October), shelters, etc. It's great for walking, hiking, running, and seems very kid- and pet-friendly. It's peaceful and well-maintained, and just a short drive from all the Northeastern Ohio cities. If I lived in Cleveland, I'd definitely be a frequent visitor. However, I wasn't as impressed with Cuyahoga as I was with other National Parks that I have been to -- while Cuyahoga was lovely, there was nothing especially especially wowing about it that would separate it from other Midwestern parks I've been to.

I love this Starbucks. It is close to home so it is very convenient for me. The service is really fast & they usually make my drinks just the way I order them. Lakemead is a very busy and loud street so my only problem is sometimes I have to yell at the intercom in the drive through and I feel bad for the employees haha but either than that, this is a great location.

First take out order here tonight, via UberEats. Ordered Butter Chicken, Eggplant Bharta, Palak Paneer, naan.

The Good: 
-Portion sizes are enormous! Overflowingly full, full-size take out containers (see photo)
-Eggplant Bharta is delicious - so flavourful and not too chunky, as I like it
-Palak Paneer is also fantastic - sufficient paneer, and the dish still tastes like actual spinach (which I don't find everywhere)
-the chicken in the Butter Chicken is moist and flavourful

The Not So Good:
-the Butter Chicken sauce tastes like Campbell's creamy tomato soup - thankfully that's a soup I like, but certainly not how Butter Chicken should taste 
-the Naan was flat like a pancake and very doughy - it was like an undercooked roti, not the light, fluffy bread I was craving tonight - so disappointing! Hopefully it was just an off night for the naan maker? (see photo)

Stopped in on a busy Saturday night for an appetizer and drinks.  Waited about 10 minutes before nabbing two seats at the bar.  While hanging around the bar, a server came up and offered to get us a drink while we waited....nice.  At the bar, the server was outstanding, so friendly and accommodating, even with her hands very full with other customers.  Wife had the peach mojito, yummy! and I had the Moscow Mule, good as well.  The app. was the scallops with edamame......so, so good.  Can't wait to go back to have a full meal. (That's the only reason we didn't give it 5 stars.)

More like 3.5 stars. This used to be an AYCE sushi place. Now it's a Korean restaurant. 

Compared to other Korean places, the menu selection is a little smaller. But all the staples are here. 

I shall remember this as the place that makes their food really spicy by default. Most Korean restaurants tone down their spice to fit local palate. Not here, or maybe they thought I am Korean? Anyways I have been here both times and the food was spicy as hell. I had their tofu stew and that was equivalent to the extra spicy at BukChangDong. Even their kimchi and kimchi fried rice is spicier than other restaurants I've tried. Not deducting a star for this. Just a warning for those who can't handle spice. You better ask for mild.

The food quality is good here. But prices are slightly higher than average. Not unreasonable if you ask me for the quality. But when I'm hungry I don't mind just getting a cheaper meal at Joons which is walking distance.

Service is more or less what you expect from Korean places: permanently understaffed and not very attentive. But that's ok with me. Practically all Korean/Chinese places are like this. Just adjust your expectations when you visit an Asian place.

Pizza was excellent, fried mushrooms were too!  Can't wait to go back.  If you order deep dish pizza, it takes like 45 minutes to an hour to cook, so call ahead to order and they'll reserve a table for you to dine in.

Booked the Pyramid Suite. Arrived at 7pm and room still not ready. Agreed to same room type on 25th floor. After the scary elevator ride, arrived at room to find old furniture, 3 yr old mattress (checked the tag on it), and no mini fridge as I had requested. After 2 phone calls they moved us to the tower with a small tub, no more views or jacuzzi tub.  This is my first and last stay at Luxor.  MGM, New York, and Mandalay were all better.  I booked a birthday deal that hasn't been a deal at all.

The food always taste fresh and leaves me very full without feeling tired.  They have had a groupon for a very long time making this place an incredible value. This is my favorite Mediterranean place.

get take out from here once a month - fast service and mostly pleasant service 

hot pepper chicken and soups always good

chicken or vegetable fried rice can be greasy (than usual) at times

Heavily disappointed in the over all experience at this well known hotel and casino! My wife decided to surprise me with a couple of nights stay there a while back. On the first night our toilet flooded for no apparent reason. It took entirely to long to get maintenance to come up to the room to take care of the problem. For some reason the water pressure in the shower was non existent. It was extremely difficult to take an enjoyable shower. In addition the water didn't seem to heat up much at all. The only thing that met expectations was the comfort of the bed. After expressing our dissatisfaction with one of the managers, he offered us a free night stay on a future reservation. That was greatly appreciated by us, however when we decided to finally use it, he never responded to our emails. We kept on getting the run around when we called customer service and was told only the manager could set up our comp night, and the only way to correspond with him is through emailing, which he was not responding to. Total unacceptable business practice from a big Hotel and Casino like Planet Hollywood. We definitely could of done a lot better for the price. We will make it a point to tell as many people as possible, so they wont make the same mistake we made!

Wow! This place was pretty disappointing! At 7pm the food all seemed dried out and like it had been sitting there for hours! When they did bring out fresh it was only maybe two spoonfuls of the item. So my fried and I could never both try the fresh serving unless we rushed when we saw the lady carrying out the tray which didn't work well with other customers wanting to try the fresh serving as well!
If you're looking for the best burger and fries in a casual setting not to mention the wings and the ribs this is the place to go!

WORST SALON EVER. save your time and never go here. 

from the moment i walked in until the moment i left, these ladies were so incredibly rude to me. my hair is a bit past the middle of my back. i was told my haircut would cost $35 even though according to the lady, it was so thick and long that it should be $40. but we agreed on $35. the ENTIRE time i sat there, every few minutes she would try to guilt trip me about not paying enough for my long hair to be cut. when the owner came in, the two of them started talking in persian. the owner kept pointing to me and making faces and shaking her head - it was clear she was talking about me. i said "what happened"? and the lady cutting my hair said that the owner is upset that im being charged so little and that i should pay more. by this point, it was the 5th time they had told me that i shouldnt be paying so little for the haircut. i said "next time i wont come then if it is such a huge problem". she sarcastically laughed. then went on to tell me how they have the greatest haircuts at this salon and use the best products. but they didnt use ANY products on me at all! and i saw nooooo products even on the counter except for the cheap hair spray that you can get everywhere. then the owner walked by again and said to me "for your hair, you should be paying $60 but ill let you pay $40 this time". i said, "no, we agreed to 35, im not paying 40". and then the owner just walked away. then AGAIN a few minutes later the lady cutting my hair told me that "a blowdry alone for your hair costs $35". she kept telling me how hard my hair was to do because it was long. at this point i was soooo frustrated at these women i just wanted to get out of there. SO incredibly unprofessional.

i should also mention that after washing my hair, the lady handed me a hair brush and said "brush your hair". this has never happened to me! ridiculous. also, while washing my hair she spilled water all over my back and neck. so incompetent. never, ever go here!!! waste of time and it will just ruin your mood. save your time, energy, and money.

Seriously, this is one of the best Asian restaurants in the entire valley. Amazing service, quality, and portions at a very reasonable price. I have heard their happy hour is unbeatable too. I just moved to the hood and plan to make Flo's a regular stop. I also heard the owner is PF Chang's (Paul Flemming's) ex???

All the Urgent Care locations were purchased by Care Now and as of 1/1/2017 they DOUBLED their walk in rate to $150! 
Go to UMC or other walk in places its only $70.
Belle ambiance ! Beau bar . Mes cocktails  étaient délicieux et les huîtres succulentes.

First visit and we loved the charm of this little place. Waitstaff was great, except the two women working, straight up rude. Beers were disappointing sadly. With so many great brewers in Arizona they need to step it up. We knew they didn't offer food, but you can bring food over from the pizza place next to them...again that was disappointing too.

I got pawned to Supersmile by a doctor who decided to sell her practice and couldn't be any happier. Dr. Chamberlain is very pleasant. His assistants Brock and Terri are awesome! I'm done with my treatment but I wish I could still go back to see their friendly faces for another 2yrs.

The sandwiches were OK. The hot ones were cold and the cold ones were warm. Forgot half of my food (I used Uber Eats). When I called back, they left me on hold continued to take new orders. I was listening to them for ten minutes

I was very disappointed with the service I received here today. I came to barb's with no intentions of purchasing a dress, I wanted to simply shop to gain an understanding of the type of dress I might purchase in the near or far future. My mother is terminally ill and we don't know what the future holds. When I told the sales woman my situation she simple said "you're not buying a dress, i need to let this woman try on before you" and walked away before I would even respond. I had already been waiting about 20 minutes and picked out about 6 dresses. 

I understand the need for her to work with people who would be ready to buy but the lack of compassion for my situation was absolutely shocking. I would of been happy to wait since I did not have an appointment and I was not positive I was purchasing, the woman's only focus was money and in the end lost a sale and future customer. Luckily I left there and went to a competitors and purchased a beautiful dress and it was a wonderful experience for me to have with my mother and a memory I will always cherish.

So i go here every morning for a fruit and fibre muffin and a coffee. Here is the deal, a muffin cost's 10 cents if you get the coffee. Great muffins and an ice coffee ( i get it with milk, no cream) is $1.00 during the summer. FUCK WHAT YAH HURD!

For the location and the price, this was totally awesome. Ohio City (the surrounding area) is full of plenty of bars cafe's and restaurants that are easily within walking distance. Also the west side market is very close (essentially across the street.) The hostel was clean and the people working the front desk were helpful if you had any questions. Seemed pretty knowledgeable about the surrounding area. Everything that is on their website is true (read: they aren't trying to sell you something that they aren't.) Parking was easy (right across the street.) There is also a cool rooftop deck with a nice view of downtown. There are tables and chairs up there so it would be a cool place to get food t go and eat up there. My only 2 things to note: 1) spring the extra $10 for the private bathroom (the shared ones were fine, but after a rough Saturday night for some people you may not always know what to expect), 2) remember that it is a hostel, so there are people going out and it can be a little louder in the night hours.
Very quaint place with good food, good service and an awesome beer selection. Really like stopping here for a Friday lunch or a Saturday beer. View of the park and river are nice. Try them out.

This is a Panda Express, nothing too out of the ordinary. You get food for a relatively good price, you get the quality that you buy for. Like how fast service is, for the taste that is given back. Nothing more to such.

The lady at the Bar was beyond Rude I drove a half hour to eat at a restaurant that a friend told me about at work and I didn't even order because her service was so terrible and I know it has nothing to do with the hands that prepare the food but the experience was terrible.

Pretty good breakfast. Especially for 5:30 in the morning. I had steak and eggs. The steak was good, a bit too well done for medium rear. The service, once available was adequate. The hash browns were  a bit soggy. The big plus 24 hrs service.

Horrible is an understatement, need to Take the manager of this location and give him the freedom of unemployment. Tried 2 separate times to go here and could not even find someone to help . Today I waited in an empty Lobby/customer service area for 10 minutes and when someone finally showed up he said an oil change would be 2 hours, last time I go here , obviously by the other reviews I am not the lone ranger on this review!!! Seems there is a pattern

The positive reviews on this place cannot be authentic .. No way

Over priced crap. Also, I believe they douse your food in a weird chemical to give the food an "authentic flame grilled "taste. One of the The owners  is rude, but still have the nerve to say hi when I walk PAST them.   They got an attitude with me because I wanted an extra tomato slice. Forget this place. Not worth the money. TBH the whole Monroeville mall food court is a dump.

Was happy to see this place pretty packed on a Saturday night.  Menu was decent.   Drinks seemed pricey.   For a distillery was surprised there was NO showcasing of their homemade liquors and cocktails.  Once we inquired there were some specials to chose from.  I ordered the Scottsdale Sunset made with their infused grapefruit vodka and that was pretty good.  
We ordered fairly healthy.  Husband enjoyed a deconstructed turkey club and I had a falafel burger.   Good portions and food seemed fresh.  Certainly want to go back and try their more southwestern pub cuisine which seems to be the theme.  
Biggest complaint was the absurdly loud techno music which didn't match the scene, vibe or sports playing on tv.

So my cousin keeps raving about this spot since I took him to another spot very similar concept Forte. It just happened that the other night stars align got together for dinner. Forte for me best of the best comes to Bulgarian or Eastern European food. I came in with open mind not compare both places but obviously similarity in the food and other things very different. Overall say both solid choice if need for legit Bulgarian food.

The first impression with the ambience and decor interesting. They have the restaurant broken down in two sections on one side there the bar and another side just straight restaurant dining. The whole point of that is restaurant part is non smoking so guess wanted keep it true. You can see the other side since part of it glass walls. I never walked around the bar area but modern, like the way look from the outside, and bar tables area that can order food. In the bar area lots of wide screens usually have games on. They definitely stick with european theme has english premier soccer league games on. Also on the restaurant side they have wide screens. The artwork feels Bulgarian all along the walls. 

It was my first time but like mention earlier cousin is HUGE HUGE fan. So for the most part just followed his lead came to ordering. He recommended trying the stuffed peppers, mixed grill, and the biscuit cake. I started with the chicken soup just cause Forte has the best chicken soup and as much as keep open mind. I saw chicken soup just had to get it. It was good. Talk about huge bowl. It was definitely hearty soup with lots of chicken, potato, and couple more ingredients. Flavor wise good but lacked deep and no WOW like Forte. Forte just fyi half the size bowl. But call it a cliche sometimes bigger not always better. The stuffed peppers was tasty nice feta cheese filling and solid. It deep fried with batter. Again similar but different stuffed peppers at Forte same concept just not batter and deep fried. The mixed grill that was the big comparison. The meats were really good. Three different ones plus pork chop. The names not remember but totally traditional style one sausage link style, another more hand form patty style, lamb skewer, and the pork chop. It was served with massive amount of yogurt /cucumber sauce. The link and patty were both really good. Either spot could just be carnivore all night long. The subtle differences keep going back to between the two spots. The mixed grill at Forte get three different meats only but like the fact the sides get three different awesome sides. Again you get more food for your mixed grill but is bigger always better?? The biscuit cake was interesting. Nothing think traditional biscuit about the dish. Truth it was delicious. It heavy dessert so make sure leave room cause its one of the popular dishes on the menu. One that if going for dessert end night at BG Bistro would highly recommend. The 3 egg omelette exactly that basic but added ham. It was loaded with feta cheese mix. It was actually filling but overall probably not the best item show Bulgarian cuisine. My bet. 

The service was fabulous! One thing interesting they have button that can call the server (they have watches that buzz them). Friendly, attentive, and awesome.

All the prices are very reasonable most items under ten dollars. The grill items or little more. You get lot of food for your money.

Please tell me what I need to do to have you guys STOP calling me. I didn't buy my Camry from you guys. I had an oil change one time and had to wait almost 3 hours and that's with an appointment! Anyway I don't care for your service. I've been getting numerous telemarketing calls and each time I requested that I be place on the DO NO CALL list. The calls are originating from out of the States....they don't have a clue of what to do....they don't even speak proper English!
The texture can't compare to the real stuff in Rome (or anywhere else in Italy, I assume), but the flavor is authentic.  And the little fake Palazzo is a nice place to sit and eat.

I see Kasia W. at Zolton's and she is a fantastic stylist. I have naturally curly hair which is very tricky to cut right and she does it perfectly every time. Her color and styling is always on point as well. She really is tremendous!

This Ghirardelli's is at The LINQ. I tried their Sea salt caramel sundae for the first time and it was delicious to taste the sea salt with vanilla and hot fudge. 
I like their customer service there because someone always greets you when you come in with a chocolate sample.
Overall a good little dessert place if you're craving anything chocolate!

Good dinner! Service was good however good was average.  Great selection of Chinese and oriental options. Some good items included prime rib, turkey, seaweed salad, tomatoes and mozzarella! Some not so good included lobster bisque, deviled eggs and cold crab legs! Definitely would eat here again however will probably just try some other buffets! We got a travelzoo two for one so it was definitely worth it for us!!

Where gamblers go to die or loose their teeth. 

Went in on a Friday late night because we saw it from the street and needed to use the restroom, it was a ghost town! Maybe 15 people at the slots. No open tables. Bar was the of caliber you should only get bottled or canned drinks. 

On the plus they has some cheap bowling!

So... I'm here now, been sitting at a table in the bar area for about 15 min. At least three different employees have, literally, walked right past me without saying a word. Not one word. No eye contact, no glass of water, no "Someone will be right with you," no "GTFO of our restaurant," nothing. The only reason I'm still here is that I wanted to post my review while it was still fresh in my mind, and I also want to find somewhere else to eat before I leave.
I've been here twice, it's really close to my work place and it has also a very long line-ups every day!  But I think it's worth it!

Great food, small portions, high price and odd parking.

I had a small burrito and tea for $8, which isn't so bad if you would get chips or something and more than 3 bites out of this delicious burrito. Now I do have a big mouth but the burrito was still small.

I would pass on it.

First time here on my lunch break.... Poor customer service for Non Spanish speaking or reading customers. When asking the cashier information as to how to order she was very rude, "The lines are according to the type of meat you want! Can't you read it!?!" If I could I wouldn't be asking....
Everyone is great! I got in right on time, my waxer was helpful and friendly and did a great job!

I really liked this place. It was my first time here. The place is clean and everyone was nice.. The bread was soft and tasted great! It has a bit of a cafeteria feel but thats ok. Its quick and fresh.

The portions are small with not a lot of filling for the price. The basket of nachos with pico de gallo was so small, we ran out of chips before we barely touched the salsa. Added gaucomole and it was an extra $8! Food was just ok. They try to upsell you on food and drinks.

The service was kind of slow but the staff was great, kind and attentive to our needs. I think my server's name was Liang (cute girl). She would consistently and constantly address my table to reassure me if I was doing okay and if I needed anything else (this is what i call over-service, but it was a royal treatment and it felt very nice).
It was my first time having such a savory waffle in sooo long and it was better then I expected , almost out of this world! This place has great desserts ranging from crepes, waffles, ice cream and funnel cakes! I would definetly recommend this place (and also the Not Just Vanilla Waffle! hehe)
I was very pleased with the quality of the food, the freshness, and the friendly service. I will definitely be back again. Thanks for the great desserts!

Love uber. I have used uber to pick up my 79 year old father who can no longer drive. It gives us time to be with family even when we don't have time to drive around town picking people up.
It really has given my father some of his independent back which is priceless.
Before uber there was no options in Las Vegas. If you called a cab it would be super expensive, take forever or never show up.
Plus we no have our night life back we can go out with friends and not worry about who is not drinking to drive.

So we stayed across end the street at the rumors boutique hotel and walked over to gamble for the first time in Vegas I forgot her name but the server working by the cage Saturday 8/13 around 2-5 p.m. older women (with nice boobs) stated she started in 1991 or 1995 had a daughter birthday in January was the BEST she made us want to book a trip again and stay there she was attentive outgoing and even gave us great suggestions on drinks and the backstage pass. We were so happy with the service we came back the next day to try and tip her again and get waited by her but  we couldn't find her  We ran into a Russian blonde head girl with an attitude issue just walked off with even taking our drinks down didn't card me which was stupid because I look so young came back with one drink for me and not for my sister but carded my sister it was weird the service from the first time there was what we were looking for hopefully next month...

Very satisfied.  Found positive reviews online and decided to try this place.  Thought my brakes were going out and I was ready for a large bill but it turned out to be just some glazing on my brake pads.  No charge.  Thanks.

They are a "small animal" pet hospital yet they don't look at "small animals".  Got rejected from this hospital for my hamster.  They were very rude about it too.  Not impressed.They say they look after small animals and, under "New Client', they give you the option of exotic and other, which hamsters fit under.

This is a great place if you are a local and live in the south part of town.  You always hear mixed reviews about this center.  Look, it's a 9 hole par 3 and they always have deals going on.  I usually go with a foursome and the last deal they had was 2 drinks and a card for $25.  That's not a bad deal.  They usually have golf and a meal specials too.  I really like this place because I can go right after work and tee off at 6pm because they have lights.  If you aren't a local and want to visit, no problem they have rentals available.  There is also a driving range too.  There are a lot of golf courses in Vegas but The Callaway Center is a cool spot to chill have a few beers and play golf for a couple hours.  Cheers!

Wow, this place is a gem. We were craving some asian fusion food in vegas, and stumbled into this place. We arrived at 6pm on a Saturday, and we were seated immediately. The place looks amazing and has fantastic decor. Very quiet and peaceful with a wonderful open kitchen.

Our server brought us some delicious fresh made nan to start us off. As good as any nan i've had in India. 

I ordered the rib eye steak. My friend ordered the fish of the day which was a sole fish with dungeness crab. We ordered a side of the fried rice as well. The fried rice was so good that we ended up ordering another half way into our meal! My steak was perfectly cooked, and my friend's fish was so juicy and soft. 

The dessert... let me tell you about the dessert. I ordered the gelato and sorbert that came in an ice teardrop (refer to pic). You have your pick from a variety of gelato and sorberts. We got coconut (my favorite), white chocolate espresso, and mango passion fruit. Everything was orgasmic. My friend ordered the blueberry cheesecake, and it was fantastic Not too sweet with a slight tarty kick to it.

As for service, 5/5. Our server was extremely attentive, and we had a seperate server that would refill our water everytime we took a sip of water. 

Overall: highly recommend!!

Fantastic! My niece had her third open heart surgery at 2.5 years old. Her parents were staying in the Ronald McDonald house across the street from the hospital. I wanted something to TRY and help them relax for a little sleep, and stress snack on when needed.
I ordered small box that included pop corn, cheese & crackers, and nuts. WITH SHIPPING it was under $30. delivery expected in 7 business days, which should have been about 1/2 thru the recovery time.
Should have been, but my niece is a true Angel and with all the prayers and love, when my package got there they were headed home!! Ronald McDonald house called the company to pay the shipping and have it forwarded.... Harry and David said "keep it, share it with those still waiting" and they sent out another order to my brother and sister in laws home completely free!!! Amazing! Absolutely Beautiful! Sure enough, about 5 days later my brother called to report a 5 star package! Presentation, Assortment, Delicious Flavor!! 

We absolutely couldn't be happier and will always choose Harry and David over any lame bear shaped cookies, or balloon bouquets.

My favorite spot for Groceries in Champaign, although I usually go to the one in Savoy more often. I think they have the best produce and more options in terms of organic food (aside from the obvious Strawberry Fields and the like). The salad bar, deli, and soups are pretty solid too. I'm a fan.

I also really love their gas program. Just for buying groceries there you can get huge discounts at their gas stations. I've gotten $.75 off per gallon a few times, it's awesome.

I cannot say enough positive praise for CAC! The staff is always professional, caring and attentive to both the athlete and the parents! One of few gyms that teaches life long values along with skills. Not only can I speak as a parent of an athlete, but as a HS Cheer Coach. Our school team had an overnight camp at CAC which they are still begging to go back next year! A+ gym!

This is a typical casino restaurant that's stay's open 24/7 serving food which exist in all Vegas casinos. For the most part, it does its job with easing the stomach if you're starving after a night of alcohol (like myself) and if there's nothing else open.

For the food, it was mediocre at best and a little overpriced. I ordered the corned beef hash which wasn't terrible but for the cost, the portion was very small. Little cubes of corn beef hash really doesn't cut it for $16. However, the corn beef was flavorful and really made the dish along with the eggs. The potatoes needed a touch up on seasoning. Nothing some salt and pepper couldn't fix though.

I didn't come in with high expectations and knew the possibility of tasting nothing ground breaking as I've been to many places just like this. Though small, the corn beef (meat alone) and the service earns this three stars in my opinion. The prices need some work for what you're receiving.

Breakfast 12/12/2015

A friend of mine recommended we bring our daughter here for her first checkup(she is three). I could not be happier with the experience. 

I was so nervous that my daughter would have a meltdown or simply refuse to allow the dentist to look in her mouth (terrible threes...) but the staff and doctor were so good at making her comfortable and distracted that she did great. 

When we left she asked if we could come back tomorrow :)

Had a great lunch at this place with my fiancé. Highlights from the menu were the Thor tots, chicken wings with sriracha honey and the krypto-dog. Server was friendly and the bartender Josh was great too. Josh apparently knows magic and is not afraid to show off his skills, when asked. We will be back for sure after the official grand opening, especially to see more magic tricks! :) 
Dessert?
Food is great, staff are friendly and helpful when ordering, but the wait to actually get your food is far too long, hence can only give two stars.
Love this place. I usually get the Iced Americano no matter what the temperature is. damn good, that's what it is. Dark 'Arse is a great spot.

Love, love, love this place! Been eating there since it opened. Honestly, one of my favorite places to eat breakfast EVER! Killer Mexican breakfast plates (couple of fried eggs, beans, chorizo and fresh tortillas) and their pancakes defy logic...divine really! They are just so good! Some of the best pancakes I think I've ever eaten at a restaurant.  Weekends can be a little crazy and sometimes, AS OF LATE, I get the feeling they are running short with waitstaff. Servers aways appear to be running all over, cant seem to keep up and having done the whole server thing myself in college I feel for them. I know that look :/

Management: You guys need more servers on the weekends or expos - food runners, anything to make things run smoother and less "the sky is falling" for the clientele. Been there 2 Sundays in a row this month and felt service was slipping a bit. I truly love the restaurant though and the quality of food is top notch!! The ambiance is cool and the location is on point. I will keep eating there no doubt...just get more servers already!

Not quite sure why I'm giving this place only three stars, but I cannot think of a reason to go much higher. The food was good - tasty and served fairly quick. The staff was ok - not the friendliest, but I've had much much worse!

Parking wasn't a problem, but there were not many spots close by - so depending on when you go - that could be an issue!

BTW - when they say not that spicy - they mean for a Mexican - for me it was darn hot!

I moved out in in January and it was still along the rives across from the trains. Kind of an old looking bar, but far from anything trashy. I enjoy going to watch the Penguins hockey games because I don't get them since I moved from home. They are able to get them at the bar and I usually have no problem with this. The staff is usually nice and helpful. I can understand it my be rough to get your drink order if you can't get the tender's attention when its packed.

My only qualm is with their move to next to Fraternity Row. Business plan that worked out, right? 

Anyway, just go early enough so you can avoid the table of "bros" sitting next to you going into detail of his latest blowjob. Seriously, if these guys could use their storytelling talents when it comes to blowjobs.....then KSU would be pushing out Hemingway's and Oscar Wilde's in  record manor.

/rant
My best dinner in Las Vegas, very authentic Chinese noodle, I have to come back again.

We had our wedding 11/12/2106 in the Venus gardens. The wedding was more than I could have ever dreamed of. It was beautiful.  Our wedding planner was fantastic. It was so easy to plan I couldn't have been happier. Of course a little pricey but what do you expect it's Caesars palace in last Vegas. Also with my package my hair and makeup was included and I would highly recommend them to anyone they did an incredible job!!

An awesome place to burn an entire Saturday morning. The place is tiny, yet the staff has a tough time getting food to your table in under an hour. 

The French toast had an overwhelming taste of onions as it was most likely cooked on or next to the gyro on the next table. The English muffins are flown in upon order from England...that is, I assume such since it didn't make its appearance until I was paying the check. The soup was blah...I never really got to taste it because it defied the 2nd law of thermodynamics as it never chilled.

Anyone who is familiar with logistics will sure to suffer a major anxiety and/or panic attack. The disorganization is beyond anything seen since computers were invented.

So my gf and I thought we would try this place out for lunch.  I had chosen it on a recommendation but didn't really know what to expect.  This place is LEGIT!  The second you walk in with the French music playing and the smells that just surround you, it mimics a Parisian French Bistro quite nicely.  

The food. No words can describe the food.  We shared the Provancale Crepe and Montgmarte and it was absolutely to die for.  The taste and ingredients, just perfection. 

The service is the owner and its a family owned in the Seville shopping center, which makes for nice afternoon shopping to walk off the many delectable calories from lunch.

Desert we got the last crepe on the menu, can't remember what it was called but it had rum and orange and it was quite possibly the best dessert I have ever had. Ever. Anywhere. 

Go. Check it out. You won't be sorry.

Oh my goodness. Extremely overrated and packed. Do not fall into this tourist trap, please please please. It may be worth it if you have kids. We purchased extra tickets to make it to the topmost part of the tower and actually never made it bc the line was so long.  The views were okay. It's just a bunch of buildings. It was not worth the wait for me.

I absolutely love Coco donuts! They are always fresh and don't leave that weird oil after taste like some donut places do.  They don't have any of those fancy cereal covered donuts, the donuts here  aren't covered in Peeps for Easter nor do they have an extra pound of candy on them as decor,  they are just donuts, good old fashion donuts.  Donuts like the way they were meant to be!  

The store front is small and there is not much room to eat there, it's definitely more of a pick up and take home to enjoy kind of place. 

The customer service is average, not great but not bad. I've come so many different times and days and I've never once had any issues like some other people have, maybe they just didn't like the attitude of certain customers and they are selective to who the sell to? Who knows! But the average customer service is easier to deal with than average tasting donuts from other places. This place will continue to be my go to!

I stopped in here for a light dinner on a very hot day and ordered the cheese and meat platter with a glass of wine.  Everything was great!  There were so many cheese choices that I didn't know what to pick but the server was nice enough to help me choose.
Great place for vegan friends, I am not vegan. But my friend is and she really enjoyed it.

There pizza was good but their calzone was amazing. If it's a busy weekend I suggest calling in to make a reservation. 

We got a large pizza and large calzone and it was enough for 6 people. Very filling and I would definitely come back here.

TERRIBLE JOB MADE NAILS BLEED TOOK TWO HOURS AND GUY WAS RUDE AS HECK. ALSO CHIPPED all my nails after 10 minutes im still in the parking lot. cut them toooooooooooo short. paid 38$ for regular polish. each hand is a different length. asswipes. didnt do the coffinbshape right yet still charged me for them.

So happy I came here instead of GNC, the associate Garret was extremely helpful and friendly. He recommended a delicious iso100 whey and the customer service was above and beyond!
